items.title: The refund procedures for this train…
items.review_text: The refund procedures for this train line is a scam and absolute rip off. It is designed to take your money and charge you additional fees to refund it. In short I bought a return ticket for 16.20 and realised this was a mistake and I only needed the outbound portion. I called up greater Anglia and the call handler was not only rude but said it was my fault for booking the wrong ticket and that I have to pay a £5 admin fee for them to grant me a refund. In the end he mentioned I will only receive a refund of £1.20! Nasty scammers! Why doesn’t greater Anglia use all that money it’s scamming of people to make a simple only refund service that people can fill out themselves without being charged a scammers fee of £5. It is so hard to navigate and find this on their website.

items.title: Beyond Frustrated
items.review_text: As a regular commuter reliant on Greater Anglia, I'm beyond frustrated. Constant strikes and endless delays disrupt my daily routine, while sky-high ticket prices drain my wallet. When I've reached out for assistance, the customer service has been anything but helpful, leaving me to navigate the chaos on my own. This isn't just inconvenient; it's a significant source of daily stress that impacts my ability to work efficiently. Greater Anglia, it's time to step up and offer the reliable service we're paying for!

items.title: Engineering works in May 2024
items.review_text:
The recent engineering works in May 2024, specifically on the 6th of May, a Bank Holiday when many people returned from their holidays affected the trains from airports to different parts of the country, e.g., from Stansted to Cambridge, Peterborough etc. These were replaced with National Express coaches with little signage. In fact, the person at the airport who checked my train ticket to get onto the platform said nothing and let me proceed to platform 2 without a warning. I've soon realised that there is no train. I checked signage and very little confusing information was given. I've asked and I was informed about the coach at platform 10-11, another person was informed about 9-10. We both asked the coaches coming into platform 10 and they knew nothing. We went to the National Express office ticket (next to platform 21) to be told to return to platform 10. At platform 10 we were told to go to platform 21....

Little information, confusing information etc and in general overwhelmed staff from a company that doesn't give a damn about their customers who bought tickets in advance. 

Getting a coach instead of a train leads to double the travelling time. Would I get reimbursed for the considerable delay? I think I should be because you sure as hell saved a lot of money by understaffing the train station on a bank holiday when a lot of people are travelling.

items.title: why not pay with ideal
items.review_text: why not pay with ideal, only with credit card/g pay/paypall, if the ticket machine is turned off, you have a problem, not good service

items.title: Thank you Irina!
items.review_text: Thank you to all the incredibly helpful and understanding greater anglia team at Liverpool Street station who, against all the odds, helped to get my handbag back after I managed to leave it on one of their trains. A particular thank you to Irina who really went above and beyond. I have seen all previous poor reviews regarding regular delays and pricing however I can confidently say that the people who work for the company are 5 star. Thanks again for all your help

items.title: Overcrowded and don't care
items.review_text: I commute on Dullingham - Cambridge route daily. It is always super busy, to the point where the staff have openly announced and apologised for overcrowding on numerous occasions. So if you're aware it's bad, why not attach an additional carriage? It's not like there's no engine to pull it, do explain to us why you cannot do it? I'm paying a huge sum of money to travel in cramped conditions daily.

items.title: Really awful pricing system
items.review_text:
Really awful pricing system

No flexibility on their tickets policy, amending a booking costed me as much as the ticket value. Really unhelpful customer service, essentially bouncing you from department to department all saying that there's nothing on earth that could be done to help.

Also when did charging £60 for a one way off-peak ticket for less than a 100 miles distance became an actual thing?

items.title: INSTITUTIONAL RACISM & DISCRIMINATION @ GREATER ANGLIA
items.review_text:
I travelled on a GA service from London to Hertford East and witnessed two GA staff racially profiling when checking tickets - no Caucasian, Asian or South Asian person was approached or asked (they were clearly invisible) yet EVERY SINGLE Black person was targeted, approached, and one instance physically grabbed by a WHITE FEMALE member of staff. 

The issue was reported to GA providing the date & time, station where the incident occurred, & physical description of the staff involved but unsurprisingly  GA said this was not enough information to investigate. 

On the same day 2 GA members of staff falsely stated the station did not have an accessible toilet, yet there was one 3 feet from where the staff were standing. The staff assumed my hidden disability meant I wasn't disabled.

When making a complaint to GA, including the two members of staff ID badge numbers, as well as the time, date & station, again GA said this was not enough information for them to investigate.

Greater Anglia are institutionally racist & discriminatory.

BEWARE OF GREATER ANGLIA

Travel at your own risk!

items.title: Lift at Billericay has been out of…
items.review_text: Lift at Billericay has been out of service at Billericay for upgrade. The alternative is the shuttle bus to shenfield. Tried on two occasions to use it with limited success. Last week it took 30mins to find the driver. But worse is the hopeless AI bots on Head Office Complaints teams. Station staff advise to Complain. Complaints Dept respond with random wrong info such as 'nothing wrong with lift'. Complaining is more stressful than the original issue.

items.title: Really not surprised to see what a low…
items.review_text: Really not surprised to see what a low rating this company has. Train was delayed by 20 minutes yesterday with very little information on a freezing cold platform. Put in for delayed repay only to be told by them today that they couldn't see any delay! What do they look at...it was delayed by 20 minutes !!  Either very poor customer service or just trying to avoid paying!

Not able to use contactless to exit and received at £100 penalty fare with 6 other bemused travelers. Why is a so called London airport not accepting touch in and out? Why does the receipt not have the 7 digit GA number to make it easy to appeal? 16000 people caught in the last two years by what is flagrant profiteering.... anachronistic, greedy and small minded.... muppets

items.title: Strikes again and totally unapologetic
items.review_text: Strikes again and totally unapologetic. To be honest I've never been overly impressed with the service, particularly not being able to get a seat when going from London to Norwich for most of the journey. This morning I got to the train station at 04:50am for my train to London, where I was covering a shift as a nurse. The guy was just like "strike day, no trains until 0900", he clearly didn't care about the inconvenience caused. Greater Anglia offered no alternative or replacement, so I panicked and payed for a taxi. So I've now had to pay for a train ticket and a taxi to London. Awful service, if you're going to strike every other week at least offer a bloody bus replacement or something.

items.title: God knows what I’d have done without a ticket office
items.review_text:
Planned to go to Barrow on Good Friday leaving at 06.14. Derailment between Lancaster & Barrow would add up to 2.5 hours.
53 minutes later a very patient and helpful staff member (Peter ?) worked out an alternative route leaving @ 05.23 arriving 40 minutes later than the original train but up to 100 minutes earlier than would have been.
Had a refund for my original ticket and paid for a new ticket - an extra £28 ! none of which was my fault.

My regular use of the railways is invariably facilitated by helpful staff that unfortunately are under-valued and unappreciated by all-knowing senior management.
The ticket office staff are essential given the appalling digital services and customer deterrent ticket machines.

GOD HELP THE PUBLIC WHEN THE POWERS THAT BE ENACT THEIR WISHES.

items.title: The worst customer service I have come…
items.review_text:
The worst customer service I have come across. I book a London Evening Out ticket from Norwich. I receive an email saying train times have changed and I can get the next train. I check on the website and they are still selling tickets for the original time. Ring the customer service number and choose general enquiries to be told by a helpful gentleman that they are national rail enquiries and know nothing about any email. Refers me to option 8 sub option 3 (complaints). First time I ring message says I am through to mail box which is full. Second time I get an actual human who is about to explain when the system cuts me off. Third time it’s back to the mail box with a cheery message saying it’s full - goodbye.
Luckily I live in Norwich so will be going in to the station to use an old fashioned method of talking to someone
No wonder you have 80% of 1 star comments

items.title: Delay repay rip off
items.review_text: Thurs 29th i bought return tickets to London Liver pool St from Whittlesford in order to go to London with my wife for her birthday  - Theatre booked for 2.30 show.  We depart to Station and check the trains to find its been cancelled - infact everything that day in that direction was cancelled at that time - no alternative provided.  So to london by car it was..congestion charge, parking etc etc..so costs incurred because they cancelled everything.  Delay repay submitted and i am offered £3.70 x2 because they say it was 30+ mins late..it was cancelled..as per my GA app shows me...still does.  and of course i couldn't use the return leg of the journey because i had to drive.  Pathetic - have appealed.  Its shocking they don't refund in full your ticket if they cancel a train.  They should be paying me more for the increased costs i incurred because of their ineptitude to run a decent train service.

Lesson learned. I won’t buy a ticket online in future.

He advised me on off-peak times and helped save me money on my journey.

items.title: Smartcard, I don’t think so!
items.review_text:
I was recently forced to request a Smartcard for my ticket. Before this, I used to book the ticket online and get it sent to my phone or to the machine. It worked for 2 weeks until today. The ticket is active, I get a tick from the phone but the ticket does not transfer. 
I pass through 7 barriers including the guard on the train. He said this always happens. 
1. Why remove all other options and force people on to cards.
2. The station could help but you will be removing the staff soon. 
3. Why use this technology if not to just reduce cost to you at the expense of customers.
4. I will likely have to pay at the barriers on the underground and as this is a tap I will need to download a statement and find a form to send it though. 

They should straight refund me my travel card.

items.title: Got caught in the stansted express…
items.review_text:
Got caught in the stansted express scam. 

It should be the costumer responsibility to check the travel conditions but seen as though in London all transports are accessible through contactless and based on the setup of the Stansted Express it is very likely that the "contactless doesn't work a ticket is required" process is solely their to make the train operator additional income via fines.

So I lose the following questions:

- Why hasn't the Standsted Express complied with the request made in 2012 to be included within the London contactless zones?

- Why does the barrier accept contactless? (yes there are stations on the route that are within the zones but on the rest of the network with hybrid routes these are handled with no barriers and instead a contactless reader and barriers at the exit stations on route. Then passengers are clear they need to get a ticket or check.

- Why are there 3-4 dozen ticket checkers at the exit station at Stansted? And not 4 or 5 assistants at the barriers in Liverpool Street. Less staff who simply inform customers they need a ticket would sort everyone out.

- Why are there no on-train announcements? So a passenger can leave at a contactless valid station and by a ticket there to reboard.

It is clearly a confusing setup left in but based on the setup of the Stansted Express it is very likely that the "contactless doesn't work a ticket is required" process is solely there to make the train operator additional income via fines.

items.title: No wonder everyone hates public…
items.review_text: No wonder everyone hates public transport! Honestly, if I didn’t need to use the train for this trip o wouldn’t. Absolutely rubbish. Wouldn’t recommend!

items.title: Irresponsible
items.review_text: We traveled to UK for a weekend. The trains were on strike. However, they sold us tickets (on site) for replacement buses, which was one hour later. We waited where they said the replacement bus stops, but after 1 hour there was only a crowd of people there, all with tickets. No bus came!!  After lots of confusion and anger, a lady from a bus company helped us. She called a couple of contacts and announced that we have to wait another hour!!!! They are indeed irresponsible. They did it without any info and update.

items.title: Greater Price

I use them daily, avoid when possible.

items.title: worst service ever
items.review_text: Wish I could leave a review without putting a rating that’s how bad this train service is… avoid at all costs so bad always last minute cancellation and delays always messing up your time!! stay away for your own good

items.title: Just unbelievable how bad the service…
items.review_text: Just unbelievable how bad the service is on this line. My mum is 73 years old and cant drive on the A roads anymore… so relies on the rail service heavily to see family. As a widow she tries to get out and about to stave off the loneliness… however since living in Walton on the naze she is met with a constant and unacceptable level of service disruption/alterations/bus replacement not to mention the countless strike action days…. We are mid christmas/new year and the normal working days are again under service alteration bus replacement for days on end I might add… not just a day here and there or ‘kept to a minimum’ as the reply to my complaint to them stated….So she has to get on and off a bus with her awful arthritis and add around 45 mins to her journey. I feel so much pain for those rely on this line to get to work. To think the cost of a ticket too…  The fat cat bosses of these companies should hang their heads in shame.

items.title: Short sighted train design
items.review_text:
What were they thinking when the designed the ‘intercity trains’ that run from Cambridge to London?

Too many seats crammed in so that the aisle are narrow (makes the Kings Cross train run by Greater Northern look outrageously spacious) despite the trains being half empty during some of the week day rush hours times.

There are also no proper tables (tiny flaps in the back of the seats hardly count)  so it is difficult to use a laptop if you want to work during a commute. 

Problems are not resolved promptly either, such as trains unable to display or announce stopping at Cambridge North in summer 2023, leaving it up to the driver’s discretion to let passengers know whether the train will stop at their destination or not. Why did it take a month to resolve a daily problem?

Failure to couple trains is also fairly common leading to overcrowding. 

Overall not a reliable, pleasant or economical experience.

items.title: Tried to purchase 2 tickets online with…
items.review_text: Tried to purchase 2 tickets online with my railcard, (75% discount) but their drop down list doesn't include my card. No problem, just contact customer services, 5 separate phone numbers later I was told to phone another number and use ext 8, I explained I was talking to this person on THAT number and extention. Told that they can't help but thanks for calling!!! Just got car out and drove.

items.title: Wednesday 13.12.2023
items.review_text:
Wednesday 13.12.2023
I was waiting for the train from Sawbridgeworth Station to Cambridge the train was supposed to come at 17:54 but they said it was delayed by 10 minutes so I waited up until 18:20 then they removed it from the boards, so the train was not even running late but decided not to come which I don't even know how that's possible. The next train was then supposed to come at 18:23 but that train is also delayed by 10 minutes. If it was a one off then I would be like fine these things happen but this is a regular occurrence that happens almost everyday. Worst trainline service ever.

items.title: I'd rate zero if that was an option
items.review_text: I'd rate zero if that was an option. Too expensive, surly staff especially at Liverpool St ticker barriers, they look like they are bored and hate being there doing the job and hate customers even more 😁. Delay repay is a joke as they try too hard to reject claims and close claims give the remotest possibility of an excuse. When trains are delayed the staff have no idea what is going on. This is a truly poor train company if I had any other choice i would not use them, but sadly for me and other long suffering passengers that is not an option

items.title: Bought a first class ticket at a cost…
items.review_text: Bought a first class ticket at a cost of £159 Heathrow to Yarmouth. Not even a trolly service in first. So went to the buffet car and was offered a water and biscuit. They need to have a look at LNER's First class. The toilet was also blocked and full to the rim.

items.title: railcard checks
items.review_text: been way off it with the railcard checks, stopping everyone on cramped busy platforms to check EVERYONES railcard, what genius came up with that idea, during rush hour. sort it out you scammers

items.title: Greater Anglia is great, and may get greater
items.review_text:
I am not sure why people have a downer on greater Anglia. I have taken over 20 trips over the last eight weeks and the staff are intelligent,kind and helpful and only one train was ever late, and then by just 2 minutes, and that was due to some idiot getting stuck on cantley level crossing, so not greater Anglia fault.
The trains are funky and cool,and naturally not UK designed and built, no UK company could ever come up with something to compare with swiss design and imagination. The only issue I have with greater Anglia is their powerless in dealing with horrid passengers having witnessed three vile teenage girls abuse both passengers and the conductor horribly. I later discovered the CCTV doesn't capture sound. Obviously they knew this. It was truly awful, and all three girls come from Cromer!!!

items.title: Utter joke of a company
items.review_text: Utter joke of a company.  Everyday delays and/ or cancellations on the Liverpool Street - Hertford East line with shocking and/ or absent customer service care. How can they continue to operate this line and get away with this level of service? Do not buy a house anywhere served by these incompetent muppets. Joke

items.title: They deduct £10 for refunds
items.review_text:
They deduct £10 if you try to refund your ticket.
I accidentally booked a ticket on a day I had already booked one. I applied for a refund minutes after completing by the purchase but they still deducted the £10.
There’s no other so inhumane and ridiculously cruel train company.

items.title: Worst trains in the UK
items.review_text:
This train operator is an absolute disgrace! They do not allow people to purchase tickets on board (even though at a number of stations they allow you through the barriers using oyster / not a ticket). 

Stay away, get the bus, do anything to avoid.

items.title: Lost Property - lost forever!
items.review_text: As soon as I got off a train at Brimsdown I realised I had left my baseball cap (very precious to me as a gift from New Zealand) on the train. Despite calling customer service (ha-ha) straight away there was no way anyone could speak to the train or upline station, so no chance of retrieving it. So someone has picked it up before a staff member could retrieve it. Reporting it online has had no results other than emails saying it has not appeared in lost property. So if you see anyone with a blue cap with green peak, and NZL1 in green letters, it is probably mine!

items.title: The inspectors are very racist L
items.review_text: The inspectors are very racist, especially a bald short men not much above 5’10 wears glasses. I called onto him and he straight up ignored not to mention he had initially ignored checking my receipt. So far I have had two incidents like that both of which have short hair and wear glasses, they are white men by the way, however I’m not attacking this company as a whole, I am just saying as a service provider we expect more from you, and lately your employees have not been providing the customer service we do greatly trust Greater Anglia trains can provide. We need feedback and justice. This is a message out of honesty and love to the company.

items.title: Well done.
items.review_text: I travelled Ipswich to London using a wheelchair. At every point staff offered help. From the person on the platform in Ipswich telling us where to be so we where right for the carriage to accommodate the wheelchair. The ticket inspector who asked if he could order me assistance at Liverpool St. The porter in London who had to take us to a different lift as the usual one was out of order. It was the same coming home again too. Polite and considerate. Both train on time too. A pleasant experience well done.

items.title: Seating not designed and built for humans
items.review_text: I have just started commuting again after 3 years of working from home having to use the so called upgraded trains from Norwich to London. Who designed these trains omg was there any user testing? The seats are so upright and stiff and the width of the seats are not adequate. Also if you sit  window side there is what I suspect to be an air con unit running the entire length of the train so you have to sit with one leg up on that to be comfortable.  These new trains are very disappointing - have another go at designing a new train and let us know how you get on 🫠

items.title: Promised refund that has never materialised?
items.review_text: Promised a refund in July for £20 admin fee I was charged when forced to change my date of travel due to rail strikes.  Now mid September and still not received the promised refund?  Despite several phone calls to customer support and emails using their complaints system, no explanation or update has been given just more empty promises and still no payment.  It’s a disgusting lack of customer service or customer care.  Is it sheer incompetence or is it simply a practice of lying to customers?  Either way it’s totally unprofessional.

items.title: Truly appalling company
items.review_text: Truly appalling company. Cancelled a train to London that was needed for a connection on the Eurostar to France. Knowing this company can't run trains, I left lots of time in London before the Eurostar train to France. Of course Greater Anglia cancelled the train while we're waiting on the platform, all the while the screen said "on time". Then at 9:40 am, when it was meant to arrive it changed to 10:40am and "on time", simply never arriving, no text, no email, no announcement on the screen, nothing. Had to drive instead and later complain, which I did and they said there were no reported cancellations!!!! So was I and other passengers imagining the train never showing up? Carried on complaining until the woman on the phone checked, eventually agreeing that the train had been cancelled. She then agreed to refund the fare, it'll take 2 to 3 days etc etc. A week later, still no refund, I call up to find it had NEVER been actioned, she'd lied to me. The guy now on the phone a week later then puts me on hold, and then cuts me off. I call back complaining again, they cut me off again. Such a pleasant company huh? AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL company.

items.title: Always a great experience travelling…
items.review_text: Always a great experience travelling with Greater Anglia. Staff are very polite and assist you whenever possible. Last Friday my mobile phone slid off from my coat pocket and onto a friends car who drove off as I was waving desperately. Luckily met Jill, Chelmsford station, and she was ever so helpful and supportive and did everything she could to assist me. I wish there will be more Jills around, the world will be a better place. Thank you Jill and I wish you all the best 🤍🤍🤍

items.title: No help available after delayed train
items.review_text:
No help available after Delay causes missed connection and more than doubles journey time. 
All that can do is give you a leaflet about complaining. 
This does not get me home or complete a 10 mile journey in less than 2 hours.

items.title: Always on rail replacement at weekends
items.review_text: Always on rail replacement at weekends. But, of course, none of these reviews even register for these corporate scum bags.

items.title: This service even getting worse so the…
items.review_text: This service even getting worse so the train was going one minute before the time have to departures,so the drivers don’t deserve nearly one hundred per year.

items.title: The service from Ware to London…
items.review_text: The service from Ware to London Liverpool Street has been appalling for over a year now. The revised timetable is a joke and trying to travel in rush hour is ridiculous. Trains always cancelled and delayed in the evening and gaps of over 40 mins between trains at the busiest time (4pm to 6pm). Absolute joke of a company and service

items.title: My railcard was out of date by 1 month…
items.review_text: My railcard was out of date by 1 month and was charged with an offence by their prosecutions team, ordered to pay £89 for a journey that cost me about £10 in total, how can this be fair and not a massive scam? On your website it says penalty fees are £20 so you're just trying to rinse people for as much money as possible.

items.title: Cheats.
items.review_text:
Cheats.
Our train was cancelled after an hour of already sitting on it, and three next trains.
We were told to make alternative arrangements ie national express.
As everyone rushed to take the coach (Stansted airport) we could not get home for the next 3h.
As traveling with a small child and already having been on the go for a number of hours, we took a cab on the advice of Stansted express staff that we would be refunded for all the alternative journeys.
We managed to get home spending extra £80 on a cab and after being stranded for 4h at the airport after already long travel.
Now greater Anglia argues that there were no delays on that day, and that we are not getting our tickets refunded let alone alternate journey.
We shall be referring this case to the consumer rights.

items.title: Greater Anglia's service is extremely unreliable and staff don't care
items.review_text:
Greater Anglia's service is extremely unreliable with trains frequently delayed or cancelled. 
When I mentioned this to one customer service agent's his reply was, "Yeah, it happens to me too." What a joke. Even the people who work for them know they are unreliable and are apathetic to it.
They don't care and don't seem determined to improve their service.

items.title: I accidentally booked two tickets with…
items.review_text: I accidentally booked two tickets with GA for Stansted express without realising. But I thought I give it a chance and email them to get a refund and I got an excellent respond from Amy in costumers relations! I am very impressed 👍

items.title: They try in every way to confuse you to get more money from you through fines
items.review_text: Complete nonsense, I entered the gates to catch a train, NO SIGN SHOWN, NO PEOPLE TO TALK, I arrived at Stansted and only there I get to know that I needed a ticket. In the entire greater london area you can use apple pay or contactless except using Greater Anglia. Stay away, use any other transport. Avoid this scammers.

items.title: Service never runs
items.review_text: Service never runs, says there are delays but then cancels trains. Difficult to get refund. If you can avoid this service, do. If the government can refuse to let them operate, that would be ideal. Awful service, never ever reliable.

items.title: Horrible and incapable of understanding staff
items.review_text:
I have been travelling with my little sister which is 17. In rush I bought her child’s ticket ( now I know that people are considered children under 16) because in my country people are children until they turn 18. When we arrived at London Stanstead, we showed the inspector our ticket and then we realised our mistake. The lady seperated me from my sister and wouldn’t let me speak to her. She started interrogating her without any empathy. She was incredibly rude and when my sister told her that it was an honest mistake and misunderstanding she wouldn’t change her aggressive attitude. She told her that she wouldn’t let her through if she didn’t pay the fine on the spot which she obviously didn’t have enough money for (we are both students from a foreign country). My sister was almost crying and was asking her if there is any other way to pay (like a bank transfer), but she wouldn’t listen and wouldn’t change her aggressive posture. I realise I made a mistake and bought the wrong ticket, but is that a reason to fine me £50, make me pay for a new ticket plus disrespect and humiliate my sister. The fines are unreasonably high. Greater Anglia says that you can appeal the fine if it’s a genuine mistake but from what I have heard nobody has been refunded. Is this normal because in my country this wouldn’t be tolerated 
P.S it’s not like we didn’t have any ticket we just had the wrong one and we were willing to pay for the right so I think the fine is unnecessary

items.title: Arrogant!
items.review_text: Absolutely horrific officer at Stanstead getting off the 08.25 train from Liverpool Street. Can’t believe the level of arroganse shown towards us as a group. One person were given a childrens ticket by another employee and was fined 60 or 70 pounds for using the ticket. The behaviour of this person was not acceptable at all.

items.title: A great service.....But!
items.review_text:
A great service, punctual and friendly staff.
My moan is: I have travelled on quite a few train operators services but I have never found more uncomfortable seats than on Greater Anglia Trains. They may be OK for short travel but for longer trips a big NO NO.

items.title: First time on one of the new trains
items.review_text: First time on one of the new trains. Reasonably comfortable with an OK amount of leg room however seems they have tried to fit in as many seats as possible which makes it all rather too cosy.  The isle is so narrow its easier to try to walk through sideways, as long as you don't have anything on your back.

items.title: 'Casual travellers/Emily' need to get a grip
items.review_text: Prices are shocking and so is the service.  All these 'casual travellers' (Emily)  who travel once a week are the ones who need to get a grip, not us regular commuters who fund this service.  Come back when you commute more than 1 day a week and pay over £800 a month for it and have your trains delayed at least 1-2 times a week after working 10 hour days.

items.title: Not warning about cancellation on…
items.review_text: Not warning about cancellation on time,train replacements very poor ,took me more then 3 hours to get home using their replacement

items.title: Zero stars for customer service if I could
items.review_text: Day return trip yesterday which required a change of train each way. I am 65 and have a senior rail card but on recent journeys have not been asked to show it. However on the final leg of my journey and with only a minute to my destination the guard asked to see it. I could not see it in the trainline app and didn’t realise it was because I’d changed mobile network provider and had been signed out. Panicking because I needed to get off in minutes I couldn’t remember my log in. The guard said I would have to pay a £100 fine, I said but I have a valid rail card and refused. He then said he would tag my ticket? I was scared about what that meant but Google says it then requires further scrutiny when exiting barriers. There are no barriers at my destination station as it’s a little rural station? He was an unpleasant jobsworth over a £7.65 ticket that I’d saved £4 with a railcard. Found the railcard on the app when I logged in correctly at home.

items.title: My family and I had to sit on the floor…
items.review_text:
My family and I had to sit on the floor from Cambridge to Liverpool Street … your service is an absolute joke and all of you that are on strike should grow a pair of balls and find a new job if you’re not happy, like every normal person does.
I really do hope you all get your act together.. and stop being a load of melts ! You’re embarrassing

items.title: Train is always f******* delayed never…
items.review_text: Train is always f******* delayed never ever put your trust in this service it is the worst train line i’ve ever used seriously. always cancellations and delays just get rid of the service useless

items.title: Absolutely horrendous service - AVOID!
items.review_text: Absolutely horrendous service. They've changed the TT again to suit themselves, with no thought for passenger safety and the only confirmation we got was a little A4 piece of paper on one of the ticket office windows! The carriages have all been reduced from 10 to 5, so we're all standing nose to nose, packed in like sardines. £6.2k a year for my annual ticket and this is what you get. GA deserve to go bust.

items.title: What a bunch of muppets
items.review_text: What a bunch of muppets! You hold a train outside Cambridge for a red light which means we are late for the connecting train!! Why not delay the connecting train, surely you would have known lots of passengers would have been looking for the connection.

items.title: Never book tickets at a station!!
items.review_text:
Never book tickets at station!!  Book them online.
My father booked a train ticket at one of their stations and had to change it to go another route.  They charged him another £22 on top.  I'll be raising a complaint about this but they are not great at responding.

Edit: they responded and said that charging a pensioner £47 for a ticket that should have cost £16.50 is fair and justified

Never book with them at the train station - always book online so you won't get scammed by these thieving crooks.

items.title: Overpriced and unreliable on weekends
items.review_text: One of the worst bits about living in Chelmsford. Staff are nice and helpful and the customer care is fantastic but it is really expensive and there are bus replacements every other weekend (for the same price even if it takes you 3 times more to get there)

items.title: Fake Roundtrip
items.review_text:
I bought a roundtrip ticket from Stansted Airport to London (Tottenham Hale) at the airport machine and, on the printed ticket, it was written "Return Any Date". However, when I exited the train station in London validating the ticket, the machine did not return it (I have no clue why).
On the same day this happened, I contacted the customer service at "refunds at stanstedexpress.com" and "contactcentre at greateranglia.co.uk" but I did not receive any reply. 
Eventually, I had to purchase a new ticket to return to the airport, costing me 21.40 pound. Overall, this inconvenient costed me the additional 21.40 pound I had to pay for the new ticket plus the extra cost I paid for the "return" I couldn't use (12.40 pound) for a total of 33.80 pound.

If you read my review, it means I have never received a refund.

items.title: Very disappointing
items.review_text: Train was late then disappeared off the screen altogether leaving everyone wondering where it had disappeared to. Had to look on Nat Rail site to find out that it was even further behind than it was advertised. Trains themselves have barely any legroom and the aisle is only wide enough for a very thin person to get through. Also the power points have a plug socket and 2 usb slots. They are under the seats (I did take a photo but can't seem to submit them on Trustpilot 🤷‍♀️) - very difficult to actually use! The usb slots in mine when I finally managed to get it plugged in did not charge my phone. Luckily I had a plug in the bottom of my bag and that worked but I worked up quite a sweat in trying.

items.title: Absolutely useless
items.review_text: Firstly their Harefare promotion is a con. It's for day returns but doesn't mention that except in the small print. I fell for it when booking a return for myself and a single for my mum. Took a bit of time but managed to get my ticket refunded and buy the right ticket. Then a week later the money for my Mum's ticket is refunded  (which I'd never asked for). In the meantime this ticket has gone up £8. And there is apparantly nothing they can do about it.

items.title: Negative reviews need to get a grip
items.review_text: Too many negative reviews.. I have lived in greater anglia area all of my life and have taken trains during high school and college. I still get a train at least once a week. I have NEVER had any problems, and when I did it is because *I* didn't buy a ticket. Staff are lovely and my only complaint is the price of food + tickets but prices everywhere are rising so can't hold it against them specifically.

items.title: Beyond Useless and Non-Existent Customer Service
items.review_text:
I was left stranded at Prittlewell station on the night of Friday the 1st of March 2024, and as a result had to pay £40 in a taxi, which I was informed by a Greater Anglia employee I would be reimbursed 

I had to catch the last train back to Wickford, the 23:02 from Southend Victoria to London Liverpool Street. There were police cars and an ambulance outside the station, the timetable said the train was delayed due to a trespasser on the track between Southend Victoria and Prittlewell. 

I pressed the information point button and spoke to a Greater Anglia employee who informed me a train should be arriving at 23:25-30. I waited but no train arrived, between 23:30 and 00:00 I was told that a replacement bus would be put on. I was anxious by this stage as my phone battery had died and my children were waiting for me at home (earlier I had told them I would be home by 23:30). 

By 00:30 there was no bus and no trains in sight, it was also raining. The GA employee told me via the information point that I would need to make my own way home and that they would reimburse me the cost. This was annoying as, if I had been informed of this at 23:30 I could have organised a taxi then but was told about this bus service that never materialized. 

I had to ask the policeman if he could phone me a taxi which he did thankfully. A taxi quickly arrived and I got in, he informed me it would be £40 and I would need to pay upfront. I attached the receipt and a screenshot of my bank statement in an email to GA. The short version is because I could not find my single ticket home GA would not pay me a cent, not even a refund of the ticket! It's a good job I'm not teenage girl isn't it! Absolutely awful company who simply could not give a **** about their customers. AWFUL.

items.title: Tottenham Station Mohamed!
items.review_text: Just wanted to show appreciation to a man called Mohamed in Tottenham hale station who i believe was a supervisor. He was helping a lady in a wheelchair until she reached her cab! Such a wholesome man !!!

items.title: Greater Anglia - still the opposite of Great.
items.review_text:
I have been able to avoid Greater Anglia for the last 3 years. I carefully chose direct trains in to and from London for my wife's birthday. They cancelled the return train a week before we left and on the day of the journey in, changed part of the journey to a bus. This they did without any notification. In fact the day before we departed they sent an email saying "you are off to London - here's all the things you can do when you get there"

I'd suggest Greater Anglia focuses on running trains and not tourist guides. They may want to change their advert of a bounding rabbit to a three legged tortoise too! Genuinely abysmal service and we just hand over the cash.

items.title: Was assaulted walking up the stairs at…
items.review_text: Was assaulted walking up the stairs at Stratford Station today. Shouted out for help, the member of staff standing less than 20 feet away just ignored me. He could have prevented this before it happened but he simply ignored me. While talking to him, yes I was angry, he wasn't interested. I asked to speak to the station manager but he wasn't there. A lady came up and she told him to walk away snd as he did he was laughing! He actually thought it was funny, thats disgusting. That lady repeatedly tried to justify his actions telling me he had followed the guidelines. I told her to make sure she filed an incident report so they could track this man down. I also tried over and over to contact this company via phone and messenger. It took them over 20 minutes to reply and when they did they didn't want to help. Awful service.

items.title: What's the point Billericay
items.review_text: Whats the point in having 2 entrances when only one is open most times. Me and my Wheelchair bound father choose to use Billericay Station. It has the option to use the downstairs entrance to reach the platform. This was closed today so had to use the top entrance. Once we got up the hill and went through the main entrance we came across 2 members of Greater Anglia Staff standing around doing nothing. one of the lads was on his phone watching something. We went unnoticed until someone in a green vest asked if we needed any assistance. The Gate was still closed after i picked my car up later in the evening. No excuses to not have the gates open.  Rough time of first visit 14:50

items.title: Single fare prices are ridiculous
items.review_text:
Bought an off peak single to Norwich today on the GA app by mistake. I should have bought a return, so my fault.  
How come I didn't notice such a silly mistake? Because the return is a few pence more expensive than the single fare!  How can it be that a single and return are basically the same price? Ridiculous,  and a rip off. Confusing and skewered in favour of GA, no wonder people are abandoning rail travel.

items.title: Stop striking you are costing people…
items.review_text: Stop striking you are costing people there jobs and wages. Had to miss three days work this week because of your selfless striking attitude and lost three days pay because of your stupid strikes. Pay your driver's properly and that way people can get to and from work.

items.title: Bought a ticket for a train that…
items.review_text: Bought a ticket for a train that departs at 0958, went to Liverpool St Station to board it, discovered that train doesn't exist. Service staff told me that I had bought an itinerary, and an itinerary does not equate to a ticket. Whatever that means.

items.title: lmfao
items.review_text: lmfao, the 'audacity' with which I was painted for simply asking Greater Anglia staff which platform the Braintree train was departing from (it wasn't by the standard platform). What even is their job?

items.title: Quicker to walk than book on line
items.review_text: No problem with the trains- it is the on line booking service that is useless. Have been trying for two hours( not the first time) still no joy. Tried on my android device and got no further than ' find times and tickets '. Just freezes. Tried on the web ( smart tv) .Filled in all my requirements and got ' no tickets available '. That  is very unlikely as I had previously tried, got tickets ,and it froze on payment. Then I had to prove that I wasn't robot which I was unable to do on my device as I don't have a laptop. No ticket offices open and it wouldn't let me do a return on the phone, so how am I supposed to get these wonderful hare fare offers which incidentally was only a total saving of £2 over normal prices.

items.title: Trains are very outdated (no working…
items.review_text: Trains are very outdated (no working wifi, often less than 1 toilet per carriage, seating taken from old buses), usually on time but can be late, very slow

items.title: If I could give a minus rating I…
items.review_text:
If I could give a minus rating I would....on going compensation  issue since the 13th Jan not one clear concise responses different answers still not rectified beyond frustrated with customer service.

I travel on these trains all week so the once a weeker's really hold no relevance in having an opinion on the service, luckily you don't have to pay extortionate rates with a sub standard service.

items.title: Trains are late too and too many…
items.review_text:
Trains are often arriving late and too many cancellations considering how much they charge.
Also when using contactless payment they over charge and the refund takes over a month at times.

items.title: Al limite della truffa! Ci hanno fatto spendere quasi 20€ in più del dovuto
items.review_text:
Al limite della truffa. Abbiamo acquistato 2 biglietti presso la stazione di Liverpool Street dicendo esplicitamente che ne avremmo usufruito per 4 giorni. Ci sono stati fatti pagare due biglietti settimanali (7 giorni) alla cifra di 38.40 £ l’uno, senza dirci prima del pagamento che si trattava di biglietti da 7 giorni.

Abbiamo scoperto guardando poi sulle tariffe del trasporto pubblico di Londra che la quota massima giornaliera pagando con contactless a ogni ingresso è di 7.70 £, che moltiplicato per 4 giorni fa una spesa nettamente inferiore (30.8 £). Acquistando due biglietti abbiamo speso quindi 76.8 £ anziché le 61.6 £  che avremmo speso pagando contactless a ogni ingresso.

Circa 20€ di differenza! Al limite della truffa, il tutto condito da un’impiegata veramente scortese e poco disponibile.

items.title: They're a bunch of criminals
items.review_text: They're a bunch of criminals, it's a tourist scam! Next time I"ll take the bus again, bought a ticket online, not exactly the right one but when I travelled from Stansted to Liverpool At. items.title: Travelled from Norwich to Southend…
items.review_text: Travelled from Norwich to Southend today, 22/4/2023. Trains were very reliable and punctual. Staff were generally polite and helpful. Now the downside. Many of the local trains have the 5 abreast seat configuration. These seats are hard, narrow, (even for someone slim), and the narrow aisle means that if you sit in an aisle seat you will be constantly bashed by other passengers moving around. Lastly, but by no means least, is the price. Our trip from Norwich to Westcliff cost £116 and took over 3 hours. I also had to drive to Norwich station because the weekend engineering meant that the  bus substitution would have taken too long. Fuel in the car would have cost £35. If my son and daughter in law had been able to attend the event, that fares would have been hopelessly disproportionate for a day out. You have to do better than this if you want more business and to encourage more people onto trains as part of an environmentally friendly effort.

items.title: Good Train Company
items.review_text: Very lucky to have Greater Anglia as the rail company in my area. Nice customer service, service is usually on time and if late, it is usually made up. Fairly recently implemented brand new trains on all lines, which is a massive bonus.

items.title: Poor customer comms
items.review_text: Never proactively communicated the process of changing a ticket, bought for a specific time, when my plans changed. Charged £81 for a penalty ticket. Would have been perfectly happy paying up to full price.

items.title: Racially abused and harassed by an Greater Anglia train inspector
items.review_text: On this day Thursday 29th June 2023 at , 8:25am, I was harassed on the train from Chelmsford going to clacton for work, I had to get off the train at Thorpe le soaking cause of how I was treated unfairly, and felt discriminated cause of my skin colour, I was told by an train inspector that I can’t use the toilet, the inspector kept on following me and trying to stop me not sit on any other seat. I bought my ticket from Chelmsford to clacton on sea, but the train inspector kept on accusing me that I didn’t come from Chelmsford and all black passengers always refused not to pay for tickets and are all the same. I couldn’t take a picture of him or his ID, but I  will know he’s the man when I see him. BLM

items.title: Was on time by 10 mins for train at…
items.review_text: Was on time by 10 mins for train at Stratford.  It pulled up without opening doors ate platform.  I moved forward to board but there were so many people trying to board that I had to go to the front of the train.  By the time I reached ther the driver closed the doors and pulled away.  i am a disabled customer.  I approached the platform female guard who said  she was not responsible it was the driver as he has control.  her manager said she was the best guard he had.  God help us as to what is the worst.  `on questioning she admitted that she had witnessed that I was trying to board the train.  The manager said I had missed it!! This was so outrageuos and Greater Anglia are breaking the law in the way thsy are operating.  I was advised the train was runng 1.5 mins late and that the driver was within his rights to close the doors on me.

items.title: Extremely poor
items.review_text:
The trains themselves are OK, I use the Cambridge-Norwich trains a lot and they are absolutely fine. 

The rubbish begins with bikes- you need to put it into a specific compartment or the driver themselves calls you out for it. Six bikes is not adequate space, especially if mothers with prams block the dedicated bike space. I have personally seen train crew get on the phone in front of me because of that, phone the next station, and claim there is no more bike space on the train, despite only 3/6 being present with the rest of the space blocked by prams and suitcases which could be easily put elsewhere. This needs to stop, if this is a space for bikes then suitcases and prams must not be allowed to block that space. They can go anywhere else in the other 4 carriages. 

Finally, Greater Anglia has the worst refund policy in the UK. I needed to return a £10 ticket and this was refused on the grounds that when a cancellation fee is deducted 'there is nothing left to return'. These 'cancellation fees' are nothing but blatant theft, and this is truly awful and really tarnishes the image of a company which is otherwise perfectly fine.

items.review_text: To anyone using this train company if you are issued a penalty fare make sure you get a recept from the person taking your details so you can appeal and pay the reduced rate .i was not given a receipt so waited for the post,the next correspondence i got was 4 weeks later from a debt collection company for the full amount  stating i had lost my right to appeal or  pay reduced fine.greater anglia customer service is non existent,i appealed the fine and won,this company should not be aloud to run a train service because they are unfit to do so and treat their customers as cash cows and think they  are not answerable for their actions,really bad experiance  avoid using them if you can.

Very poor lack of accessibility for disabled passengers; wheelchair users made to feel like a burden and difficulty accessing ramps, cancellations and last minute changes a frequent occurrence (and when trying to claim refunds, are then refused despite services being cancelled). items.title: Assistance travelling
items.review_text: I can’t say much about the train service or times etc but while having to use the assisted service for my son going from Wickford into Liverpool St for his appointments in London the service was exceptional. I mainly booked ahead but on returning we did not know what train we were able to get because you never know how long you are going to be at our patients. However when we got to Liverpool St Station it was no bother for the staff, they got the ramp out and radioed ahead to Wickford and on the 5 occasions we needed this assistance the guy was always there waiting for us. I can’t fault the assistance service and a big thank you to everyone. I can only remember a couple of names, one was Sam at Liverpool St and the other was Kev at Wickford but well done and a big thank you to all concerned.

items.title: Dishonest Company
items.review_text:
This is the most dishonest and disgusting train company in the UK and their licence to the Stansted Airport must be immediately suspended. I hope this review come to the attention of the Stansted Airport Management and the Transport minister.
I travel often to Turkey and most of my journeys are from Luton or Gatwick. I always use my contactless bank card to open the gate and pay for my journey. It turns out that you cannot do that to Stansted and you must buy a separate ticket. Why the double standards ? Why I can do it to Luton or Gatwick but not Stansted.
Additionally I boarded at Liverpool Street. Staff member saw me using my contactless card and carrying a huge luggage. Why did they not advise me that I need a ticket?? Why there was no signage or staff inside the train ? Easy answer, the company policy is to make you travel this way, so they can charge you once triple the ticket price when you arrive to Stansted and have to rush to board your plane. This disgusts me and it is acceptable in a developed country like Britain. I have no idea how this was allowed. I'm truly shocked and disgusted and I cannot recognise this country anymore

items.title: Bought a return journey on Anglia from…
items.review_text:
Bought a return journey on Anglia from London Liverpool Street to Norwich.

The ticket was for first class... there was not even a first class carriage on the train. This happened on both legs of my journey. There was also no warning in the station beforehand - I walked the entire length of the train looking for the carriage!!

THEN - to submit a claim you have to obtain a special card from the staff on the train... how would you know that in advance??? Fortunately I submitted my claim from the train and found that out before I got off!!

Finally.... a valid ticket is made up of not 1 piece of paper... it is 2... are they serious? No wonder the railways are a f#@$£g mess!!

items.title: outragous charges and unacceptable treatment
items.review_text:
On 18/8/2023 I was stopped by the member of staff and while we were processing my ticket checking I realised my rail card was expired. I admitted my own fault and I was cooperating with the officer. He accepted my apology and took my details and he said  the head office will make the final decision about my case. Realising my mistake I renewed my railcard shortly after the incident. He took my old railcard after this incident 15/11/2023 I received a latter of a £142.65 penalty charge which I cannot understand at all. Someone I next to me received a £70 payment charge right at the station cause of missing railcard. I did cooperate and I remember the officer did not let me pay the £70 telling me they will investigate my case. I admitted my fault but I clearly do not understand why my charges started from £142.65. My letter says  settlement towards the company cost is  £100. Could you explain please why the company did not let me pay £70 at that moment instead of make me wait for months and charging me double please ?
I did not receive any letter of previous penalty charges, furthermore I am unable to appeal because I do not have a reference number starting with GA or GU

I made a payment on 23/11/2023 to avoid further misunderstanding with greateranglia, however I would like to make an official complain of this kind of treatment and the fact that I had no option at all to protect myself or appeal is outrageous

I will be driving to London next time as it will be cheaper than the train and I'm not standing all the way! This company is a absolute farse. I have not brought a ticket to stand all the way!

items.title: Scum
items.review_text:
Disgusting, abhorrent company. I sadly have to endure the Hertford East to Liverpool Street service twice a week. That is if it is running at all, which it probably won't be due to the sheer greed of striking drivers.

When it does run, it will be delayed for a reason that the driver will never bother sharing. And the new timetable is a joke. They scrapped the 1642 direct service from Liverpool Street meaning I now have to change at Broxbourne with just a couple of minutes to spare.

The latest farce occurred on 30/08 when the driver decided with 10 minutes to go that we would terminate at Ware. No reason or apology given. I am assuming that it was to make the return service to London on time. So they are happy to inconvenience hundreds of commuters for the sake of a few minutes. Had time to check everyone's ticket though!

Another joke occurred last week at Tottenham Hale. I decided to use the Undergound so changed there, only to be greeted by a whole train being herded onto the overbridge for a manual ticket check. IN RUSH HOUR. WHAT IS THE POINT OF THE BARRIERS THEN? Not only did it make everyone late for week, it was overcrowded and dangerous.

I hope Greater Anglia lose the franchise. And that whoever decided to terminate at Ware is fired.

items.title: Poor customer service
items.review_text:
I’m sorry to write a negative review but this is about their poor, unhelpful & slow customer service response (time)
I mistakenly renewed my family & friends card l, thinking as my son was in education until 18, he’d still be classed as a child. 
I can see that was a silly assumption but what has annoyed me is the difficulty in getting through to their customer service railcard team on the phone..
I wanted to transfer to a two person railcard as it’s digital, I thought in this day and age, it was a simple request..
I then had to resort to using their contact form/email service, which you can wait up to 10 days for a response. 
After 12 days, I got a response saying they can’t transfer or refund a railcard, even though it’s digital..
How can it take 12 days to respond to an email.. I think they need to provide a better, quicker response to requests and have a more efficient telephone service.
It doesn’t help that the cheaper fare alert service didn’t work either.
I’m now stuck with having to pay full price to travel by train, when I could fly abroad for the same price..it doesn’t make sense..

items.title: Very disappointed with response from…
items.review_text:
Very disappointed with response from customer relations following a complaint regarding passenger comfort and health and safety.

Went to exit the train and someone perviously (as mostly dry) had projectile vomited all over the train door and button that needed pressing to open the doors. Didn’t have time to swap exits so reluctantly had to touch this persons sick.

After complaining to customer relations that this should have e been spotted by the conductor who walked through the train or seen on the cameras when it happened and therefore action taken.  

This exit or carriage should have either been cleaned or deemed not in use but the response was that it’s better the train still runs, I agree totally which is why I think the above should have happened so that people didn’t need to touch sick to leave that carriage. 

Customer relations dealt with my complaint very badly, no offer of compensation or even another journey to match this one just defended the fact that it was better to still run the service.

items.review_text:
I hate, I hate this! It's soul sucking. I swear I could sue for how much this is mentally debilitating! This has bought me to tears toooo many time for the incompetence. This train ticket system needs to change! Trying to change your ticket if changes happen, or strikes happen or just life in general happens is infuriating! If you miss your train due to a problem or your schedule has changed, you have to buy a brand new full ticket that will cost you a extortionate amount because your buying it on that day! The trains work against you! Changing the time or day even if you do it ahead of time on the journey will charge you unfair admin charge! Sadly there's no other train company to go with that will give you an easier service and so you have to deal with this.
If it wasn't for the ridiculous railcards I would be spending thousands a year just to travel to work. I know full well that everyone agrees on the idea of lowering the cost of train tickets instead of applying a Railcard on the allready-wounded system.
Something needs to change. I know you have your strikes but your also effecting other people's lives. Not everyone can just quit work or stay at home on the days you deem fitting for you. This is ridiculous. The public needs to go on strike against this.

I purchased an advance ticket to leave at 5pm london liverpool street-ipswich and asked the customer services box and the guard at the barrier at liverpool street if i could jump on the 4pm to norwich and jump off at ipswich instead of waiting for the 5pm as my meeting finished early, both parties said yes that’s fine due to the storms happening, the barrier guard passes me through to get on the train, the train guard later then tells me my ticket is advanced and doesn’t belive me even after i explained to him how could I possibly have gotten through the barriers if my ticket isn’t valid ? he doesn’t have an answer and proceeded to charge me £50 !!! even when other passanagers jumped in to tell him they had been given the same information at liverpool street regarding the storm, so in affect i’ve paid twice !! sadly he had 0 customer services skills at all and is proberbly
commissioned on how much he can make from robbing people !!  absoulely 0 people or listening skills he reminded me of a brainless car park attendant, absolutely no communication from the station guards to the train guard, both had different ideas on the ruling today regarding the storm and as a result i’m £50 out of pocket, Greater anglia was bad enough when i commuted daily a few years ago but now with a one off trip to london they are just as bad !! to add to this even with newer trains the Wi-FI still doesn’t work !! come on greater anglia you can get Wi-Fi on flights now which are cheaper !! and 31,000 feet in the air !!  if greater anglia had multiple compertion in east anglia and commuters had another train company as an option greater anglia would be in serious trouble as a buisness absolutely shocking as always !!

items.title: Appalling Customer Service
items.review_text:
Unbelievably poor customer service. As the result of a malfunction on the Greater Anglia website, I ended up with three sets of tickets for the same journey. It was a treat for my Granddaughter’s 6th birthday and was a trip to the London theatre to see "Matilda". It was my wife, my granddaughter and her Mum that were travelling.
I contacted Greater Anglia who were originally very helpful and promised a refund.
I printed off a set of tickets for the journey.  When they got on the train,  the conductor scanned the tickets and told them that the tickets were not valid. They rang me from the train and I immediately emailed over the other sets of tickets I had received.
All seemed fine on the day but now Greater Anglia have refunded only one set of tickets and, seeking to rely on the fact that they say that two sets of tickets had been scanned, have refused to provide a refund so I am £91.25 out of pocket.
I can scarcely believe this, given that it was their website that was at fault in the first place and this has never been disputed. Presumably, as they hold a complete monopoly on rail travel in my area, they can treat their customers with disdain and with a total disregard to the circumstances of the particular case. Despite having explained everything in great detail, a refund is still not forthcoming.

items.title: Worst experience
items.review_text:
Worst experience

I did not know that to go to London Stansted Airport from Tottenham Hale station, contactless payment is not accepted and instead requires a ticket. 

Upon arrival at Stansted I received a fine which I appealed however wasn’t granted: 
‘’ All transport companies operating a Penalty Fare scheme display warning notices which advise transport users of their obligations and the potential consequences in failing to meet these.
The transport user is required to show on request a valid ticket. Contactless payment cards are only valid for travel within a permitted area. It is your responsibility to confirm that your card is valid for your entire journey prior to boarding the train. There are network maps displayed at all stations within the London area, confirming the stations that fall inside zones 1-9 where contactless payment and Oyster cards are valid for use. Please visit the Transport for London (TfL) website at [website link] for further information. ‘’

My recommendations to this organisation if their intent is to offer a good customer service (which is highly doubtful based on my experience with a fine issued, as well as the ones from so many people as seen on this website):
1. Accept contactless payment, otherwise disable the gates to the platform to stop accepting these cards
2. If unable to do the above, inform customers before boarding the trains (written signs & on loudspeakers)
3. Change “London Stansted airport” name to “Stansted airport”- how ridiculous you expect customers to think that they are not in London i.e. cannot use contactless payments!

items.title: A Nightmare Experience with Greater Anglia Train Service
items.review_text:
Title: A Nightmare Experience with Greater Anglia Train Service 

Rating: ★☆☆☆☆

My recent experience with Greater Anglia train service was nothing short of a nightmare. From the moment I attempted to purchase a ticket online using their website, to my frustrating encounter with their staff at Stansted Airport, it was a series of disappointments and incompetence that left a lasting negative impression.

**Lack of Proper Signage:**
One of the first issues I encountered was the complete lack of proper signage at the train station. When you're in a hurry to catch a train, the last thing you need is confusion about which platform to go to. Greater Anglia's failure to provide clear signage is a major inconvenience for passengers.

**Inadequate Staff Assistance:**
As if the lack of signage wasn't enough, there was also a noticeable absence of staff members available to assist passengers. When running late, the ability to quickly purchase a ticket and board the right train is crucial. Unfortunately, Greater Anglia failed miserably in this regard.

**Online Ticket Purchasing Nightmare:**
Attempting to purchase a ticket using a smart device on their website was an exercise in frustration. I made repeated attempts without any luck, even taking screenshots to document my efforts. This should not be an issue in this day and age, and it reflects poorly on the company's technological capabilities.

**Unjust Fines and Appeals:**
Upon reaching Stansted Airport, I encountered a ticket agent who was less than helpful. Despite my best efforts and evidence of my struggles to buy a ticket online, I was fined. The ticket agent mentioned staffing issues and a lack of information for customers as reasons for the ongoing problems. While I did appeal the fine, it was a complete waste of time.

**Money-Focused and Unapologetic:**
My overall impression of Greater Anglia is that they are just another money-focused entity, showing little regard for customer experience. It's disheartening to see such blatant disregard for customer satisfaction, especially when comparing it to transportation services in other countries like Japan, Singapore, Hong Kong, and Poland, which are known for their superb service and efficiency.

**Appeal System as a Legal Requirement:**
Furthermore, it's worth mentioning that the appeal system, while available, seems to exist more as a legal requirement to avoid breaking UK regulations than as a genuine avenue for resolving passenger grievances. My personal experience with the appeals process left me feeling that Greater Anglia's intentions were more about saving face than rectifying their shortcomings. It's disheartening to see an appeal system in place that ultimately wastes the time of passengers who have valid concerns and evidence to support their claims. This further highlights the company's lack of genuine commitment to improving their service and prioritizing customer satisfaction.

**Neglecting the Power of Customer Feedback:**
It's disheartening to see that Greater Anglia, and companies like it, seem to neglect the invaluable power of customer feedback and complaints. A well-functioning appeal system should not just serve as a legal formality, but rather as a vital channel for customers to voice their concerns and contribute to the improvement of the service. Just like software updates that fix bugs and enhance user experience, train services should continuously strive to improve their operations based on the input of the very people they serve.

However, it appears that some of these companies, including Greater Anglia, behave as if they are infallible gods of the transportation industry, impervious to criticism and customer suggestions. This attitude not only hinders their own growth and development but also perpetuates the cycle of dissatisfaction among passengers who are left feeling unheard and unimportant. It's a missed opportunity to foster trust and build a stronger, more customer-centric service that can meet the ever-evolving needs of travelers.

**Final Thoughts:**
In conclusion, my experience with Greater Anglia train service was a true disappointment. The lack of proper signage, staff assistance, and the nightmarish online ticket purchasing process left me frustrated and disillusioned. It's clear that Greater Anglia prioritizes profits over the well-being and satisfaction of its passengers. If you have other options, I would strongly recommend avoiding this service. It's a stark reminder of the issues plaguing UK transportation services, and it's a shame that more customer-focused alternatives like Apple, Amazon, or Virgin aren't running the show. Going forward use Elizabeth Line to Heathrow Airport will be a better experience.

items.title: Oh dear Greater Anglia, Not again!
items.review_text: Oh dear Greater Anglia, you can’t seem to get anything right judging from people’s reviews…. And here’s another gripe!  Your entire ticketing system and online electronic refund system is woefully inadequate and unfit for purpose!  There are so many bugs, glitches and inconsistencies that I honestly don’t know where to start.  Every week I’m faced with a new challenge.  This latest one has prompted me to write this review and voice my anger.  This weeks frustration is:  my train was delayed so I completed your online compensation claim.  It was rejected as I didn’t have a ticket (of course the ticket barrier does not return your ticket at the end of the journey.  You said that I could submit a copy of my invoice as proof of purchase but there is no option to upload an image on the app.  I therefor manually copied all reference numbers and booking codes and sent those, but as I’ve already provided this information cannot see the use of repeating this.  The annoying thing is that I bought the tickets via the app using your software and your system and provided all booking and reference numbers so surely it’s straight forward for you to see from my account that I did purchase the ticket!  It honestly seems like you are purposefully making it impossible for customers to get a refund in order to maximise profits! Ironically, whenever I change my journey, the system is absolutely brilliant and very consistent in charging me the £10 admin fee.  This part of the system is efficient and flawless!

items.title: Warning! Scam
items.review_text:
Warning!

They have a very lucrative scam at Stansted Airport.

TFL let's you tap in and get on the Greater Anglia "express train" but when you arrive at the destination they trap you into paying a fine.

You can tap in and get to Heathrow and Gatwick but not Stansted. Apparently "London Stansted" is not part of the London train network, despite being able to tap in and get to Essex, Wiltshire and East Sussex and I'm sure many other places.. Apparently Stansted Airport is the only place you can't go without a paper ticket.

Total scam.

It's also not an express train! It has several local stops. On the same trip we flew back into Gatwick, tapped in, got the train to Central London, very fast, very good service, very few stops and it cost £12.

I would love to do a freedom of information search on how many loyal and well intentioned customers who wouldn't dream of trying to travel without a ticket get caught by this Scam.

Come on Greater Anglia, tell us how much you get from this cash cow? 

Disgusting!!

items.title: Expensive premiums, bad comms but nicer trains
items.review_text: There are times where this line is consistently good. But, when something goes wrong, it goes really wrong. This is understandable to a degree given the nature of one delay leading to others, but they are very reactive and staff at stations can be incredibly unhelpful and sometimes rude. The communication is sometimes appalling. I get it’s not their fault personally, but you’re far more likely to invoke sense of calm and amiable conversation if you’re able to communicate effectively and with some empathy. This line is incredibly expensive in comparison to others, but the new trains are nicer and spacious. However, they have far, far too many staff members at London stations. They stand around chatting and I am unable to fathom what value they’re adding. Fewer unnecessary staff will lead to less of a need for high wage roll - hopefully reflective in the fare. I do not consider GA’s tickets to come with a ‘price’, but more a ‘premium’.

items.title: Incompetence at its finest. F*** Greater Anglia

The staff are lazy and inconsistent and always on strike like you get £30k to scan tickets what the actual f***. The tickets are so overpriced and the price keeps increasing as the service goes down. Basically, I would rather see my grandad sit bare ass naked on a cactus with a haemorrhoid than take these trains everyday. Honestly, I can’t wait for all of the staff to become robots because that will make such a nicer experience than having to deal with incompetent cavemen who just stand there all day and drool staring nihilistically at the work their supposed to be doing and then go on strike. People always say if the conductors arnt checking the tickets then we would need barriers at every station but that’s not true because you could just have barriers than scan your ticket on the doors of the train. Just go up to the door and scan the ticket and if it’s in correct the driver won’t let you on. Or just use the money from the overpriced tickets you sell me and put barriers at every station I’m sure you can afford it. Screw this dog ass train company. Y’all need to replace everyone with robots real soon and be government run so that we don’t constantly have strikes and delays.

items.title: Service disruption info still poor…
items.review_text:
Well since the pandemic I now only travel into London once a week (instead of 5) and the service has been good with no issues, either in or out of London. The strikes don't bother me as I just work from home all week which is great. The GA website is still poor with regard to service disruption information. This morning a points failure at Manningtree, fair enough Network Rail's fault and not GA's fault. However, the GA website says...  Disruption details: Cancellations to services at Manningtree. Due to a points failure at Manningtree some lines are blocked. (Fine)
Impact: Train services running through this station may be cancelled, delayed or revised. Disruption is expected until further notice. (Fine)
Our advice: Train services through manning are being disrupted due to a points failure. Network Rail engineers are on site investigating. At present the 05:12 Ipswich to Liverpool Street service is being delayed Ipswich until the problem has been resolved. (Not fine). This is not travel advice! e.g., delay your journey until later, do not travel etc. It just repeats the disruption details. They have continued to do this since I last reported it 3 years ago to their customer services so I cannot see them doing the right thing any day soon.
