items.title: Travel experience...
items.review_text:
Every working day I take the train from Witham to London Liverpool Street. I have a rail card . The app decides to take my rail card off randomly and makes me pay £30 rather then £17 . I normally get on the train and buy my tickets on the way as part of my routine . It's cheaper then tapping in anyway so, I never not buy a ticket . I get fined £50 for a single . The next day there are strikes . I pay £30 again and never get the train home I paid for so have to go to shenfeild where I then pay for an Uber which is another £50 . Im 18 and I've been using this service for 3.5 months and it's been the worst experience and I've wasted so much of my money which I need to move out in a world in which the economy is already so bad . Another point to add is the trains are not smooth . They jolt side to side and sometimes it's worrying because it makes you think the train isn't safe to be on the tracks, plus someone definitely could fall ,or hit their head on the wall when sitting . 

They steal your money to get to work and they don't even provide an experience that's worth the money . Train people who deserve to work on greater Anglia, and sack all the people on strike since there are so many people who would kill for the pay they get .

items.title: Attitude problem
items.review_text:
Today the train driver of the Norwich to Stansted 09:03 train refused to open the doors to the train until 5 minutes before departure. While the crowds on the platform grew he was chatting with his colleague at the end of the train. When I asked if everything was ok, I got a curt "yeah why?" reply. I said because the train's due to leave soon but the doors aren't opened and there are crowds building up on the platform. He said his shift hasn't started yet so we have to wait. He spoke quickly and dismissively which betrayed a contemptuous attitude rather than any interest in customer service.
The train left on time so there was no issue beyond that but I'm flagging this as what appears to be a growing attitude problem among Greater Anglia staff. While a few months ago the staff at the train station apologised profusely when a storm cancelled the service, such apologies appeared more as thinly veiled virtue posturing for something they clearly could do nothing about. Today's incident, coupled with the increasing strikes (which they only do because they have no competing service) indicates that they are in fact not interested in serving the public but using their privilege to treat their customers like their enemy.

Bith website and app feel almost as if they were designed to specifically not be user friendly.  The staff are generally friendly and helpful. But due to constant strikes, rail replacements, faulty track and trains I would recomend traveling by any other option if it is available to you, I certainly only use them when i have to now which is a shame as I would in general much rather take a teain than drive.

items.title: Greater Anglia is unreliable and not…
items.review_text: Greater Anglia is unreliable and not consumer-centred; unreasonable fares. All it is good for are noisy trains whose drivers take great delight at sounding their odious-sounding horns on the new trains at 23.55 and 6.00 in pitch darkness, rain and a train passing them in the opposite direction near the sign that says "sound your horn". If they could just sound it without the need for 3-seconds aggression it would be acceptable, but it's like they have an attitude. If they think that sounding that horn is going to be enough time for a person trespassing to move, they are sadly mistaken.

items.title: Avoid GA at All Cost
items.review_text:
Whilst Train Operating Companies in general have a less-than-excellent reputation for customer care, a special place in hell must be reserved for Greater Anglia.

GA's inability to communicate (at all) not only with passengers, but also to bother to let their staff on-the-ground know what is going on, and why, is breathtaking.

Its Customer Service unit should be renamed Customer Disservice.  It excels at making up excuses based on half-truths and even outright fiction.  It's dismissive, patronising, assumptive, tardy, lazy, cut'n'paste email responses filled with grammatical errors, and the misuse of the English language, are first class examples of how not to run a CS unit.

They don't even seem to understand the difference in meaning between 'concise' and 'accurate' in emails they sent out.

Complaining to GA is not only a monumental waste of time, but more seriously also dangerous to your blood pressure.

Far better that you simply avoid using their trains wherever remotely possible.  Walk, crawl on your hands and knees, hitch a lift on a passing snail, do whatever you can not to use GA. That way you will save yourself an infinity of misery.

items.title: DREADFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE
items.review_text: My sister and I had bought tickets for the 09.35 train from Clacton-on-Sea to London Liverpool Street recently,  as we were due to start a holiday from St Pancras International. We were, with other passengers, standing by the normal gate at 09.22. We were all a bit confused as the indicator board was showing the next train was at 10.35, but there was no announcement made telling us that the 09.35 had been cancelled or that it was running from a different platform. Eventually one of the other passengers ran into the ticket office, only to be told "oh well the train is just leaving from a platform at the back a of the station and we had needed to use a different gate" Therefore at least  8-10 passengers missed the train. Because my sister and I could not wait for the next train from Clacton, we had no choice but to pay £65 for a taxi, to catch a train further down the line. Sadly all GA Customer Services are offering is an apology and a load of excuses. They have said they will look at 'possibly'refunding our ticket. What an absolute disgraceful service, we came very close to missing our holiday and this completely messed the beginning of it for us; we were so stressed. How do they have the cheek to advertise and try encourage people to use their service.

items.title: Train disappeared of Information Board like a Greater Anglia Manager does in times of disruption.
items.review_text: Train did not turn up at Thorpe-le-Soken, 40 passengers included one Disabled passenger left standing in the rain, limited shelter, no WC facilities no information and the Information Point being unanswered. 0551 train just disappeared like Greater Anglia Managers do and passengers just had to wait until a train turned up.

items.title: Absolutely worst and least reliable…
items.review_text: Absolutely worst and least reliable train company ever. Every train I've attempted to catch in the last 4 years has been either delayed or cancelled.  Today was the last straw. I'm moving.

He was really helpful and professional, polite and generally very nice to talk to.  I wish there were more staff like him @greater Anglia trains.  Thank you Daniel for your outstanding service.

items.title: I wish I could give ‘no star’.
items.review_text:
I wish I could give ‘no star’.
The Dutch company that own Greater Anglia know how bad the trains are, how uncomfortable the seats are. The only good thing is if you go to the Netherlands you benefit from how much we pay for the awful service in East Anglia by enjoying the comfort you get on NS Trains.

items.title: Unfair Penalty Charge
items.review_text: I had a ticket for a GA train and was feeling really ill. I got on a GA train for an earlier hour  to get home(same start and end destination as original ticket) after checking with the station guard on the platform if it would be okay. Station guard explicitly said if I talk to the train ticket collector and explain the situation, it would be fine. The ticket collector came along,  refused to believe the story and even insinuated I was lying saying he was on the platform before the train left and I hadn't spoken to anyone. I would NOT have got on the train of the station staff hadn't said it would be fine and now got charged an extra 75 pounds for this. When I asked the ticket collector if it was possible for him to verify this, he said it wasn't. No empathy and terrible service.

items.title: Very poor management
items.review_text: I have been trying to get a refund for the train strikes on 30th July. I have had nothing but lies from GA staff. I'd been warned that must have the tickets returned to give out a full refund, and they also advised me of this themselves. I was also warned that they will claim they never received them so send recorded delivery/signed for. As predicted they say they never received them, also claiming that the trains were not cancelled even though they emailed to say they would be. I have sent in evidence of posting from Royal Mail (screenshots showing signature from person signing), email confirming trains cancelled etc. Now, I actually support the industrial action and believe the staff are unfairly treated by GA. I can only assume that the staff are overstretched, possibly directed by management to make these excuses etc. Staff I deal with at the stations are nothing but polite and friendly - this is not an attack on individuals but GA management as a whole.

items.title: Poor information concerning replacement buses during the strike today
items.review_text: No wonder Greater Anglia has such a low rating; for instance, today there was no information regarding the times of replacement buses. All the trains are good for are aggressively sounding their stupid horns for eighteen hours a day.

items.title: Lying greedy scumbags who always want…
items.review_text: Lying greedy scumbags who always want more money, I have now started using the bus which Is half the price with nice staff who do not lie to you all the time, disgusting service, horrible organisation and just a bad bunch of greedy lying pigs.

items.title: Company lies
items.review_text: This is a warning for anyone wishing to apply for a trainee drivers role with this company. They promise you that you'll be a driver in the salary in fact you will be confined to the depot working nights for years with no real prospect of becoming qualified driver.

items.title: What a way to treat your customers
items.review_text: I bought a train ticket to London for £47 which I had booked specific tickets for. I had booked my ticket home for 17:30 however I was fortunate (or unfortunate in this case to finish early) I headed to Liverpool Street and got on an earlier time after being advised by the gentleman at the gate I could get an earlier train because it was off peak. I was then subsequently fined another £47 on the way home despite that ticket being cheaper at that particular time. Why not just charge me the differential between that and off peak or peak ticket and for a one way journey?! Total cost to London from Ipswich £94. Disgusting!!!

items.title: Ticket machine allowed purchase of ticket for scheduled cancellations
items.review_text: Went down to the station to purchase a ticket to get to work. Bought the ticket and sat and waited on the platform. it wasn’t until I was on platform, already bought my ticket at the machine, that it said there were no scheduled trains today. The ticket machine didn't say this and still was able to buy a ticket for a train that wasn’t coming.

items.title: Train Delays: True or False
items.review_text: Previous service at 16:59 to Bury St Edmunds is cancelled due to broken down train…no prior warning, then service from Bury St Edmunds at 21:26 is delayed by 20 mins due to broken down train despite trains before running…then a few minutes later the same train is delayed for 30 mins bysignalling problems & same repeated at few to 10 mins later…what’s the true story? Finally arrived @ 21:43.

items.title: Trains have improved significantly since I last travelled
items.review_text:
I have had a few "experiences" with various train operators, but I was pleasantly surprised with my recent train journeys. Obviously there is always room for improvement, but compared to what trains used to be like, it has significantly improved.

The train stock for Greater Anglia has been updated, which means electric doors, improved signage, seat capacity, where toilets and beverage carriages are located. The trains are very clean, spacious and various features such as free WiFi, which makes quite a big difference.

Staff are generally polite and helpful. For example, I left my phone on a train yesterday from a London Liverpool service to Norwich (I left at Ipswich), and I went to visit the station it terminated at the following day in Norwich - I found a help desk, and the staff were extremely helpful in finding my phone and doing their due diligence checks to make sure I was the right owner, before handing it over to me.

The Norwich train from Ipswich was extremely pleasant with smiling and helpful staff. Thank you for working hard on the travel experience for passengers, even if our train system is a bit higgledy-piggledy.

items.title: I would mark minus 10 if I could
items.review_text:
I would mark minus 10 if I could. Any odd child could see financial crisis was due from the very start of 2020. Yet these people are hurting ONLY their poorest customers and emergency workers with their relentless striking..
There is clearly no money. I hope those people get replaced by driver-less trains. 
Their ticket counters, customer service staff are not any better either. No sense of unity or giving back something.
Repulsive really

items.title: Bought a ticket to travel from Ipswich…
items.review_text: Bought a ticket to travel from Ipswich to Chelmsford on 13th August on 26th August.  The dates for the strikes had already come out. No strikes on 13th great I thought!!  So on pay day decide to advance purchase my ticket. Only to find out the next day that the train drivers decided to go on strike on 13th!! Fabulous I thought.... I didn't overly panic. I have the app & thought it would be easy to get my money back. Ummmmmm NO!!! So they wanted £10 admin fee for me cancelling 😂😂👍🏻 obviously the only reason I was cancelling was because I couldn't physically go because of the strike. So then myself & my friend decided we'd go on the 14th instead. This should be easy I thought... the app gave me an option to change date & time. I clicked on the tiny button. It flashed up that this option wasn't available to me!!! Wrong answer Greater Anglia.  The next day I phone customer services.  Oh what joy this was NOT!! Not too sure where that office is, but its another country. The lady who I spoke to for 13 minutes offered me absolutely nothing. I really tried not to be rude, but I lost my temper as she kept putting me on hold. When I wasn't on hold she wasn't actually saying anything. I had to keep saying "hello" after 13 minutes of no help whatsoever I lost the will to live & hung up. I called back the next day, spoke to a man who was more helpful.  Saud I could have a refund & waiver the £10 admin fee. Like he was doing me a favour!!!! But at least he was more help than the moron the day before. I complained to the man about the previous conversation.  I suggested she gets more training. So disappointed with Greater Anglia & especially their inept app  I would just like to say my friend uses the Train Line app & had no issues getting a full refund. I really didn't need all the stress I got  it wasmy fault I couldn't travel on a certain day. Yet they wanted money for that privilege 🙄 sort it out please. I've now deleted the app & downloaded Train Line.

items.title: Avoid it if your lucky enough to find it in service
items.review_text:
If you can avoid this service then it is best to do so. Staff are often super rude and unhelpful (asides from maybe 2 staff that are the exception in the Southend branch who generally want to help - not the ones who tell you to run for a train knowing you won’t get it). Staff can be very lazy at the ticket booth and they actually suggest going to the electronic booth (so I can’t understand why the booth stays open if they don’t wish to work it). 
Most times, there are train issues every other morning with the most excuses I’ve ever heard for a service. You are better off with the C2C if you don’t need the greater Anglia. Staff who check tickets can be very rude too. This is an outdated process for the 21st century (sorry to those that work this job) but it’s not needed. Most of us do buy a ticket!! It wouldn’t be so bad if these staff were kinder and didn’t treat every passenger like a criminal or get sarcastic when asked a question. Overall, I’m celebrating that my time with the greater Anglia is coming to a close. Unfortunately with all the strikes and broken down trains I’ve had to relocate my job.

items.title: I avoid Greater Anglia as much as…
items.review_text: I avoid Greater Anglia as much as possible: late or cancelled trains, you can bet on it; then, the mind-numbing announcements whilst on the train and the overpriced tickets. All it is good for is the sounding of horns for three seconds at five-to-midnight and five-past-six in the morning. Whoever thought that the new horns sound acceptable seriously needs to have a rethink.

items.title: Not interested in an app
items.review_text: Can't even use your online service without  "downloading the app" properly, which will steal all your personal information and sell it to the highest bidder. Just want to use your website and not have to show you all my private photos, everywhere I go and let you have access to all my private conversations. It's not worth using your service for that price.

items.title: Useless. Useless. Useless
items.review_text: Useless. The amount of times they need to reboot the new trains then cancel them. And only tell you after an alternative (albeit slower train) train leaves the station. Anyone who works there must be so embarrassed to. Then as you walk off the cancelled train and reach the beginning of the platforms you see four staff members just standing there doing nothing and having a nice chat. The worst.

items.title: Trying to book online but crashing
items.review_text: Trying to book online but crashing. No doubt more expensive if I buy at the station tomorrow. Safe to assume the train will be overcrowded as per usual

items.title: Scam on route from London to Stansted
items.review_text: Scam on route from London to Stansted, depsite having tapped in on the gate they claim at the airport that there are signs on entry station "well displayed" to order a sep ticket. I travel using trains in London for years, never came across a scam like that! £40.40 I will continue to dispute till the end of my life - my Amex Lawyers are on it :)

items.title: Not trustworthy company
items.review_text: I was travelling from London terminals to Stansted Airport and missed my flight due to technical issues on the way. It took 3 hours to get Harlow Town and then I had to take taxi to reach the airport.

items.title: Nothing has changed since the last…
items.review_text:
Nothing has changed since the last review.  You really do need to speak to me because not cooperating with Travel Watch and other oversight organisations is really not acceptable and needs to be brought into the public domain. 

Unregulated Company
I think you have to leave a minimum of 1 star sadly……

Their prosecutions and customer services department are unregulated, operating outside of The Penalty Fares Regulations 2018. 

In a nutshell, they do as they please and are unaccountable to any regulatory body linked to the rail industry

items.title: Absolutely disgusting
items.review_text:
Absolutely disgusting, basically took me for £70 as wouldn’t refund ticket due to strike 

Would rather walk than use these rip off merchants.

items.title: Why is this service needed
items.review_text:
Why is this service needed? It's not worthy

There is always a problem and you cannot trust on them.

I am even surprised that a heatwave is a problem... please, travel around the world and check hotter countries. In those, it is one of the best options to travel: Air-con and no problem with wires due to hot weather conditions...

items.title: Train due to leave 11pm still at…
items.review_text: Train due to leave 11pm still at Southend Victoria at 11.35 no informs provided for passengers for first 20 minutes

items.title: If I could give no stars I would
items.review_text:
If I could give no stars I would, after giving multiple chances for staff to fix the issue & who have all confirmed they agree they gave a poor experience that they were unwilling to do anything about it. This is by far the worst train experience I have ever had. I have 2 children under 3, we got on the train, there was broken glass on the floor, empty alcohol bottles everywhere, spilt alcohol on the floor (of which I have pictures to back all of this up & they have CCTV on the trains so they can back up themselves. I didn't dare take my kids out of the pushchair because it was so disgusting, we had no other choice but to get on to get home bcause it was the last train and with two under 3 i'm not walking about somewhere i don't know late at night! I never expected the train would be in such a state! 

 I quote an email from Greig the senior customer relations manager 'I am extremely sorry for the poor experience which you had whilst travelling with us. I can confirm that feedback was passed to the train presentation team in relation to this matter as I do agree this would make for an unpleasant journey.

I can advise that we do not compensate for this type of issue, as you were still able to complete your journey successfully and no refund would be due for the tickets you purchased as your journey was neither delayed or cancelled, which would have meant that you were entitled to a refund as a result.

I do hope that this incident does not deter you from travelling with us again in future. Should you require any further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact me again.' 

I even spoke to another staff member before that who emailed me much the same thing, then when I emailed back saying that is not good enough ignored my email completely until i chased them again a couple of weeks later asking to speak to his manager. & as you can see he didn't care much either. That is the kind of experience you can expect I guess looking at the rest of these reviews. Worst service I have ever experienced in my life, I will be telling everyone I know & every place I can possibly review to not waste their money on the company.

items.title: Was mis-sold a ticket (
items.review_text:
Was missold A ticket (ie overcharged). I wrote a complaint to the customer service team who were most unhelpful.
Train times are illogical and even with the modern trains, unreliable.

items.title: The trains were cancelled from Stansted…
items.review_text:
The trains were cancelled from Stansted Airport 04.07.2022 because of strikes, so I was not able to travel. 
For some reason they've rejected refund I made with greateranglia.delayrepaycompensation.com and asked me to write an email to (sales.support.greateranglia at trainsfares.co.uk)  or call them to get a compensation. 
Why should I spend time to submit all the details using first website and then again spend time to write another email or call to get my money back for the service you cannot provide?

items.title: 35 years commuting and treated like a common criminal....
items.review_text:
I have been travelling on this train line for 35 years and have paid a full annual season ticket renewing on time every year, other than during COVID lockdown. 

Following the recent strike upheaval and surrounding days, I travelled to London the following week, and it slipped my mind that my annual season ticket had expired the day before I travelled. I would have thought as I am logged into the GA app, I would have received some kind of reminder, anyway that aside, I travelled to London on the 5am train and when I got to Liverpool Street the rude and obnoxious ticket inspector insisted on giving me a penalty fare, even though I said I would renew my ticket there and then in front of him! 

I have since appealed twice and both have been upstanding of the inspectors decision. It is not the cost of the £38 fine, it is the principle. I pay almost £5,000 per year for a train line with poor service, regular disruption for maintenance work and most recently strikes and upheaval surrounding these days. 

Other than less than 50% refund for strike days I am not aware of any other type of compensation? I often see fare dodgers on the train and when approached the inspectors are clearly scared to issue them with a penalty fare as they just take the price of the ticket, however a 35 year commuter who has never previously travelled without a ticket [ and I note neither have my family] makes a one off genuine human error following a week of crap service is treated like a common criminal!!! 

I can only assume the inspectors are on some kind on commission for these penalty fares. The not so funny thing about this is when you get to Liverpool St there is often 5-10 inspectors/assistants standing around talking, no wonder the ticket prices are astronomical, we are paying their wages! 

The quicker I do not need the use this poorly run line the better and would recommend anyone with another option [C2C] not to do so.

items.title: Appalling customer service and no…
items.review_text:
Appalling customer service and no customer care.

Mr Burles does not care at all about his customers and disregards any concerns brought to him.

Due to the strikes, I missed shows in London and am out of pocket as a result. Rather than accept any responsibility, Mr Burles blamed me.

Avoid Trainline.

items.title: Just a quick flag that in the past two…
items.review_text: Just a quick flag that in the past two days, on different journeys and at different times, having clicked through to pay for a ticket and then inputted card details I have been told that those tickets are no longer available. When I then re look for the tickets the price has increased by about 30% and I have had to buy at the more expensive price. It feels too much of a coincidence that this happened just as I was going to pay both times and makes me wonder if they just increase the price they have advertised once they know you are needing to buy.

items.title: Worst experience of a train journey
items.review_text:
The treatment of customers by greater anglia is terrible and the worst part is that they don't care at all. 

We arrived at Stanstead after paying contactless from a London station. Upon arrival we saw that a physical ticket was required and that contactless wasn't valid, which weren't informed of. Nevertheless we purchased a physical ticket at the station to make up for having used the wrong payment method.

We were refused the right to exit the station into the airport, despite being in a rush for a plane, and told we needed to buy a ticket (at a highly inflated price) AND pay a fine. We argued and mentioned that there had been no real guidance or information available at any of the stations to explain what type of ticket was needed but the employees essentially laughed at us and told us that it was our own fault. They said contactless wasn't a valid payment option because we weren't in London (despite the airport being called London stanstead). Why would they even let us on the train with contactless if it wasn't a valid payment option? 

Upon arguing, the employee there actually admitted that it was a bad system for customers but that the company use it to make extra revenue, essentially admitting that they were scamming customers age intentionally relying on a lack of information to gain extra money from people. There were about 6 people in front of us with the exact same issue and it seems from reviews that this is a regular occurance at the station. The company clearly does not care about ripping people off or they would have addressed it by now. 

We appealed the fines and were denied, with the copy and paste response stating that it was our responsibility to somehow know every rule of every train station in London before travelling. 

I'd strongly recommend not travelling with greater anglia and just taking a coach or bus instead, it will save you money, you'll have a better experience based on the lack of interaction with greater anglia staff, and youll be more likely to make your plane on time because you can skip the queues of people as they get scammed at the station.

items.title: A scam
items.review_text: I paid 20.70 pounds for an “express” train just to queue 20 mins to get my ticket checked by hand by a couple of very slow employees when arrived at Stansted at the only open gate. I complained to one of them just to get dismissed with an offensive hand gesture and to be told “you are in a train station how are you supposed to leave without queuing?”. Maybe build automatic gates?! So pissed off by them.

items.title: Please reconsider your approach
items.review_text: Be prepared to automatically be treated as a criminal by this operator, with threats of prosecution, if you dare to make a simple mistake with your ticket booking. The precedent is that human error is indistinguishable from malicious intent. Paying an exorbitant settlement fee is not a remedy to human error, but it is a deterrent to further travel with this particular operator if more importance is placed on revenue streams than public relations.

items.title: Sporadic no catering - rubbish
items.review_text: I don’t think it’s acceptable to sporadically decide you don’t want to have catering facilities on long services from London to Norwich. On the 08:30 this morning having been short on time to make the train, to be greeted with a stock “no catering services on this train” intercom message. Rubbish.

items.title: Inaccessible, patronising and dangerous
items.review_text: My friend who uses a wheelchair was put in an unsafe situation and was injured. They are patronised by staff. They have complained multiple times about numerous instances of this and nothing changes. This is an unaccessible train service that does not care about disabled people.

items.title: Greater Anglia ticket scam and theft.
items.review_text:
Their ticket prices and conditions are scam and theft.
Greater Anglia: no fair off peak fare or day returns.
I travelled today 1 hour early than my ticket at 1 o'clock in afternoon. Had to pay £46 ontop of my return ticket. Total for one way from Ipswich to London £62

items.title: Liverpool Street - Cambridge
items.review_text:
I booked online directly from their website for a return ticket from London Liverpool Street to Cambridge.

It was cheaper than other online ticket resellers. 8 quids each way was really affordable. Train was rather dated, but it still provided free Wi-Fi onboard which was a nice touch. Toilets were clean as well.

Pleasant journey and everything was on time.
I would definitely use again.

items.title: Poor service, Refund policy is pathetic
items.review_text:
Poor service. My first travel on 10th Mar 2022, travelling from London Liverpool to Rye House, evening trains got cancelled due to issues between Broxbourne to another station. Train services were closed for more than 2 hours. I have requested refund but they have strait away rejected my request stating that no services disrupted during that day. How someone can lie like this?
Plus every week/weekend services are closed for maintenance. Not advisable to travel.

items.title: Very expensive "service"
items.review_text: Very expensive "service". Train timetable is a joke - constant cuts to rush hour trains where they only run 5 carriages instead of 10 or 12. Whoever is in charge couldn't give a hoot about customers. Purely about cutting costs and lining their pockets.

items.title: V poor service, expensive, uncomfortable
items.review_text:
This company is continually unable to provide a consistent service that is acceptable.
Train have air con but you have to send a tweet with carriage number to get in turned in.
Carriages half the length they should be in rush hour.
Would never choose to use this service unless I had to. And prices are sky high

items.title: Bad bad train line
items.review_text:
Bad bad train line, I bough a ticket from south woodham ferrers to London Liverpool Street for £33.10. 
After I finished work I realised that I lost my return ticket but I had my in bound ticket so when I got to Liverpool Street I asked the ticket office if they could issue me another ticket as I have a receipt and also my bank card as evidence that the payment has been taken out of my bank account. The answer is no and to buy another ticket! I wouldn’t even give one star if I could! Avoid this train Line!!!!!

items.title: Possibly the worst Trainline in the…
items.review_text:
Possibly the worst Trainline in the country.  Trains delayed, wifi doesn’t work both ways. On return there was a 45 min inspection train check. 

Comfortable seats, but no good if the train is late or has no wifi to do work.

items.title: Surprised at all the negative reviews
items.review_text: Surprised at all the negative reviews. Used all sorts of train companies this season and Greater Anglia were the best. Reasonable prices, nice modern trains, helpful Twitter and not too busy.

items.title: No announcement for partially sighted passenget
items.review_text:
I travelled from Tottenhan hale to Bishops Stortford today. I later did the returm journey. I had not done this journey for 3 years due to Covid.
Therefore, as a partially sighted passenger. I was surprised there is no annoucent of where the train is travelling to and which station it stops at.0
Also, the announcement of the station that I am arriving too is announced too late. It is not said as approaching the next station. It is stated after the doors are open at the station.
You will understand that a passenger with limited sight has enough obdtacles to overcome. With taking this service, youre taking aeay a person independence.
I was told by staff that thete is passenger assistancr to help me, but at Bishops Stortford there is not enough staff to assist.
Thetefore, I think if youre not going to put the announcememt back.
Then you will need to inform me of the trains travelling at 1pm, 1.10pm and 1.15pm. Then comkng back at 415pm or 430pm. Also I need to which stations it stops at too.
I wait to hear youre response.
Thanks

items.title: They will do everything they can to squeeze money out of you
items.review_text: Condescending staff, poor service. They will do everything they can to squeeze extra money out of you. A month ago I accidentally bought the wrong ticket (it was only a couple of pounds cheaper than the right one). The ticket checker was not understanding at all. They accused me of intentionally buying a cheaper ticket to ride on their expensive train. They then forced me to buy the ticket again. And because I couldn't refund the first ticket, I basically had to pay twice the train fare. Will never take another train from this company again. Avoid this company if you can, and if you can't, make sure you get the right ticket and right train, because they'll try everything they can to get extra money from you.

items.title: Appalling gaslighting customer service
items.review_text: Appalling gaslighting customer service. Made me feel like I was in the wrong when trying to buy another season ticket for my A level exams. Students deserve better from a train company than a poorly ran, rude service, milking us from the little money we have to get to school. What type of ticketing system charges you 400 quid for a monthly after paying 800 quid total for 8 months from september to may. An absolute joke.

items.title: I wouldn’t give a star at all if I…
items.review_text: I wouldn’t give a star at all if I could. I always get the same train every morning to go to work. Today I got here the train had already arrived and they closed the doors I pressed the button and wouldn’t open I asked the driver if he could open the doors and he shrugged!!! I am fuming they departed prior to their scheduled time, but it’s alright when they are delayed though? It’s a joke now I’m late for work for no other reason than today they decided to go earlier. Horrible service

items.title: Great travel company
items.review_text: I frequently travel on the Norwich to Sheringham branch and I find the trains clean the ticket inspectors polite and an overall great experience. Well done!

items.title: I was an employee as a depot driver and…
items.review_text: I was an employee as a depot driver and depot shunter at the Ilford Depot. It was a nightmare, new employees get bullied in the yard, yard controller and Rail depot manager were horrible and disrespectful,  treated like a slave, and bullied by fellow collegues, a terrible experience, I would never ever apply to this type of TOC, therefore resigned.

items.title: Worse company that comes to my mind.
items.review_text:
Never seen a company with so many ways of ripping you off. I could write a book about how many times I've experienced a bad service using their trains and the incredible variety of excuses they use to take your money and not give a remotely acceptable service. They charge as if their trains were made of gold though.

Use the bus if you can, or get a car, it'll be cheaper and at least you'll get to your destiny.

items.title: 9 weekends of no trains
items.review_text:
So far this year, 8 weekends no service Cambridge-London / stansted-London.

Add Easter weekend, all four days of it, makes 9 weekends. 

Absolutely appalling service, year in, year out.

items.title: Good trains but poor service
items.review_text: Good trains but poor service. Creeping reductions in service levels over time as prices rise - first no catering in first class then not even bothering to put a collect from shop service on early morning trains from london as “their catering team is based on Norwich”.

items.title: 2118 train from Liverpool Street
items.review_text: 2118 train from Liverpool Street. Monday night! No toilet working in first set of coaches. Ok. Went to next set of coaches - toilet also out of order. SORRY but this is OUT OF ORDER Greater Anglia!!  Sort it out please. Appalling service.

items.title: Embarrassing Service

Twice in a row the service from Stansed to Liverpool Street is suspended during weekend. I requested a refund via voucher but once I tried to purchase the tickets,they risulted to be invalid.
An extremely poor service

items.title: 03/04/22 Liverpool Street to Diss
items.review_text: 03/04/22 Liverpool Street to Diss. Wonderful friendly conductor Wayne. Took the time to have a chat and made us smile. Makes all the difference. Pity more people aren't like Wayne. Thankyou.

items.title: Awful service and refund policy
items.review_text: Awful service and refund policy, phoned within 2 minutes of realising my mistake. Would not let me have a full refund and ask for £10 admin fee per ticket. Awful service

items.title: Wish I had read reviews before…
items.review_text: Wish I had read reviews before travelling with this company journey terminated passengers abandoned no help or advice from staff had to pay for taxi to Stansted airport Refund of £2 No wonder people don’t travel by train in this country 😡

items.title: Absolute cretins
items.review_text: Absolute cretins. Not travelling due to COVID and they charged me a £20 admin fee to cancel a round-trip to London.

items.title: Please find other ways of travel is if you can!
