Everyone I spoke to today was incredibly rude. Very unhelpful and unprofessional. Trains never turn up on time or are cancelled. Rejected my appeal on my ticket fine which was GA fault, due to suddenly not accepting contactless payments on the train, when I’ve been doing this every week for the past 2 years. The number to pay the fine is a premium rate number, which is incredibly scummy. 

I have 0 respect for anyone who chooses to work for this absolute joke of a company. Teach your staff some manners.

items.title: Couldn’t organise anything
items.review_text: Couldn’t organise anything, employ snow flake staff who want more from their bosses for literally doing f all. Striking over and over. Don’t know what more unskilled divs want from a company, working on tracks through weekend day time is the biggest f up a company like this could ever do you tally destroy  peoples weekends away with your pi** poor planning. Work at night keep everything running. You need to employ people who want to work and not snowflake wan**** who just want to moan instead of work.

items.title: Any train operator should be allowed to…
items.review_text: Any train operator should be allowed to operate a competing train service to get rid of this complete shambles - post covid timetable a mess, pricing insane, customer service non existent - just been kicked off a train 2 stops before it’s actual destination with no explanation - Don’t even deserve 1 star but that is the lowest rating possible - should be negative

items.title: Crap service!!!!!!
items.review_text: I get the train into London every day to work and pay over £5k for this terrible terrible service, what on earth is going on, train have been running at a reduced service since Christmas, 2 an hour, they are packed soiled, people standing down whole carriages!! PUT THE SERVICE back to normal!!!!!!

items.title: So far experience is very good with…
items.review_text: So far experience is very good with Greater Anglia. Helpful stuffs, good new trains, always try to help in their capacity.

items.title: Total rip off.
items.review_text:
Total rip off.
From totenham Hale to Stansted airport get a ticket don't just touch card you will be charged £40

items.title: Great service from Martin …
items.review_text: We were on the 5.15 train to Beccles from Oulton Broad south, the conductor was so helpful and pleasant to us we were a group of 9 and Martin was so polite and helped us with a group save ticket great service

items.title: Tickets are silly expensive
items.review_text: Tickets are silly expensive. £40 to get to London is a joke, especially if it’s cheaper to get from London to Manchester for half the price. This company should be bankrupt or sanctioned already. Go to hell greater anglia.

items.title: G.kala and j.brydon theses are absolute…
items.review_text: G.kala and j.brydon theses are absolute life savers they help get my phone back they went threw loads of effort just to make sure I was OK they personly when to London to get my phone for me apresite them so much make the train station a better place

items.title: Awful, never travel with them!
items.review_text: Staff member (male, Stansted airport, 15/02/22 at around 14:30) was extremely rude towards me and mocked me for making a genuine mistake with my ticket. Will never travel with Greater Anglia again, there are always delays and cancellations too.

items.title: Disgusting
items.review_text: I am very disgusted with Greater Anglia. We travelled last Saturday on the replacement bus to Colchester. It is a long journey, so at our first stop which was Witham, my husband asked the driver if he could wait whilst he nipped to the toilet. The driver was very unhelpful, saying he was not waiting, if you get off you cannot get back on. We was flabbergasted and angry. So my husband had to grin and bear until we reached our destination. So Greater Anglia you need to get your act together regarding customer needs. Never again will I take one of your replacement buses.

items.title: Don't bother with e tickets
items.review_text:
Booked an e ticket this morning for travel from Liverpool Street and only received a booking confirmation, enquired with a member of staff at the station who suggested I phone greater anglia, I did and was told there was technical difficulties in sending the ticket, I provided a second email on the phone, received nothing. She then suggested I go to the ticket gate and they'll let me through, they didn't, I went back to the ticket counter and was told there was nothing they can do. I was told its "a risk I have to take"

Why provide an e ticket service if you can't be held accountable when there's a fault?

I'll be going with trainline next time

items.title: Disgusting company
items.review_text: Disgusting company. Apparently the train timetable is back to ‘normal’ yet it is worse than the reduced time table. Running less trains, shorter carriages and paying £40 to stand up compiled into a corner as it is so busy. Constantly email to ask for the trains to be added on back to how they were before covid for rush hour to get into London Liverpool Street for work and I get the same auto response that they monitor the situation. Almost everyone has complained and they have done nothing. Disgusting company.

items.title: Incompetence
items.review_text: Honestly, one of the worst companies! Rude staff, late / cancelled trains and don’t even try to get a refund! Complete incompetence. They need to increase wages and get some staff that actually want to be there!

items.title: Great Customer service
items.review_text: Just want to say Thank you To Staff at Southend Victoria,Romford and Shenfield for there great customer service helping my Daughter with the wheelchair Ramps onto the train .

items.title: New trains are ok, Wifi still garbage
items.review_text: New trains are ok. Wifi is still garbage. Not in a hurry to travel Greater Anglia again post-Covid.

items.title: An absolute money pit, not fit for purpose
items.review_text: So their app is down tonight and it’s the only way I can buy a flexible season ticket. Also noticed they’re running a reduced service on a Friday? I guess the fares going up yearly, despite the sub-standard service isn’t enough to properly run the service. Absolute charlatans. They should hang their fat cat, money grabbing heads in shame.

items.title: absolutely useless
items.review_text: absolutely useless, i’ve been told to leave out offensive words i am trying very hard but it’s just embarrassing. Got to station after checking the app for the train, at station on the board it said no train was at the time it says on the app a lot of other people were waiting for the same one, no train came no information no announcements just wasted 20 people’s lives for half an hour waiting in the cold joke of a company, then i get asked to pay for a train ticket on the next train i got? I don’t understand why i am paying 20 pounds to be late can someone explain?

items.title: Disgusting
items.review_text: Disgusting, the train always leaves the station earlier, especially the one going to Hertford East

items.title: I traveled with them twice - two times too many
items.review_text: I do not recommend this train service. Sooner or later you will be mistreated or handed a fine for something ridiculous. Even if you make this so-called 'honest mistake' which you can appeal they do not care no matter how honest it is. The only thing they care about is money, more money and more of your money in their pockets. Do not travel with them. There are other train providers that will treat you like a person and won't make you feel like a piece of garbage at the end of the day.

items.title: So I buy a return ticket from harwich…
items.review_text: So I buy a return ticket from harwich to London Liverpool Station, Its about £38 I got on the train yo return home earlier than I should have as we finished work early. Didn't think it would be a problem ad I brought a return ticket anyways. The ticket guy said I'm on the wrong time train home. I said but have brought my ticket he said I will have to issue you with a new one at £36 ? I said but that's thats basically what I paid for a return. How can one way be that much? So I ended up paying £74 for a while trip that already cost £38 . How can anyone justify the price ? The train wasn't even half full there going that way if I'm on it or not and I already paid? Absolutely disgusting service. Being green can get stuffed as well greater anglia.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Looking at the tickets for my normal journey, and realized that they have doubled the cost of a single journey. Less trains to select from so more overcrowding and more expensive. Unjustifiable. Also, why are they so much more expensive than other providers? There is absolutely nothing special which makes them worth it.

items.title: So cold in this train.
items.review_text:
Caught a train from London to Colchester today 20th Jan 22. 

It was like travelling in a fridge it was so cold in the carriage.

items.title: Racial profiled Was stopped today 19th January 2021…
items.review_text: Was stopped today 19th January 2021 Wednesday on the 13.49 at  from elsenham to liverpool street.by 3 inspectors.   Happened at 14.00 they got off at storford  my issue today was I was only person singled out i showed them my ticket all fine they looked at guy next to to me and said no mate your all good he didn't have to and said hello to another one of there mates and said don't worry . Being only black person on train I feel racial abused I was profiled on my look by the 3 inspectors makes me feel sick to the stomach

items.title: Poor company
items.review_text: I agree with others. High prices and single fares almost the price of a return, clearly taking advantage, we don’t all have an endless budget. Expensive to travel to London even at the weekend for a 45 minute journey. Long distance trains are better and cleaner, other trains disgusting. Say they’re cleaning the trains more now, that should be the normal standard. Seating should also be designed so the stupid people can’t put their feet on the seats. Customer services just give poor excuses. They don’t announce the stops so if you get on the platform late you don’t know where the train is going. Waiting rooms closed when it’s cold out. There’s always faults and there’s no trains on bank holidays which means that I can’t travel to see my family. Oh, now they’re running a Sunday service for the same price, typical.

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful! Trains always cancelled due to faults. About time they invested some of those profits into trains so they could actually provide a service!!!

items.title: Bad customer service
items.review_text: Bad customer service, I asked for help they ignored me if I could I wouldn’t give any stars they don’t deserved

items.title: Ipswich To London (later trains?)
items.review_text:
I have just moved to ipswich and commute into London for work everyday. The fast trains are lovely and clean but the slower trains are very dirty, dingy and cold.
I would appreciate if the last train time is amended it seems very unfair for the last train from London to be at 2330 when other trains still work later which end in Colchester two stops shy of Ipswich . 2330 is far too early, lots of Londoners commute from ipswich so would be very handy for work purposes aswell as going out in London for fun

items.title: Recently had reason to travel from…Norwich
items.review_text: Recently had reason to travel from Norwich to the likes of Esher, Cheltenham and Wolverhampton. Wish Greater Anglia ran the whole service!! Simply they have the best rolling stock, the most courteous helpful staff and their information in train and on platform is unequalled. Add to that the fact they run the trains they say they will and more often than not at the advertised times!! Take a train out of Euston, Waterloo or Paddington and you will realise how lucky we are here in East Anglia!! More power to your elbow!!

items.title: Curt and unhelpful
items.review_text: I contacted them about my tickets after contracting covid via Facebook chat. I was told to call if I wanted a fast response. I asked why they had Facebook chat: 'To help with queries, we can't resolve every issue I'm afraid.' Unnecessarily curt and not helpful at all.

items.title: Not Great At All Anglia- they simply avoid paying refunds with all means!
items.review_text:
This is the second time Greater Anglia you simply just fail on any form of customer services and refuse paying what you so bravely say you will!
Won’t go onto the 1st time now, as it’s too long of a story! 
Yet…let’s go on my newest attempt to get some money back from GA which they clearly avoid paying again! 
On the 2nd of December my husband and I were meant to get on a train from Liverpool St, which was cancelled, nearly 1 hour later we boarded a train that was meant to take us home, yet after another 15-20 minutes, we were kicked out of the train and told this will train got cancelled as well. 
Got another train eventually, and made it back home in over 2 hrs instead of 30 minutes. 
Anyways, decided to use the Delay Repay Service, that we clearly are entitled to and claim a refund for both of us, using the Delay Repay service! 
Any normal human being, would simply expect to get their money back, but this is not the case when it comes to GA! 
They simply avoid paying by any means.
I was using a normal paper ticket, and my claim got rejected due to apparently being paid to someone else! I simply wonder who might have access to my paper ticket other than myself?!? Won’t point fingers, but I simply doubt anyone else other than a staff member could have my paper ticket serial number! 
But this is not it!
My husband was using a rail card , filled in the exact same form myself , with his details instead of mine! 
And don’t be surprised to find out that his claim was rejected also as apparently his journey details were incorrect! 
So in a nutshell, I won’t get my money back as they found the journey but “paid” someone else instead! My husband won’t be paid as the exact same journey was not found?!?
Doesn’t this sound to you more of a way to simply avoid paying? 
Will take this and our previous claim to the newspaper’s, and to the Ombudsman hoping that maybe eventually someone at Greater Anglia will wake up and realise they simply can’t endlessly fail on customer services without any consequences! 
Thank you once again Greater Anglia for demonstrating what the worse possible customer services looks like!

items.title: About flexi ticket - waiting for my refund 10+ days
items.review_text: About flexi ticket. Hybrid office work. So, purchased their flexi ticket (first flexi ticket - had 1 trip left, no refund at all plus £10 admin fee (for a keyboard stroke???)). Ads are all over: so easy, cancel anytime.!!! No way. This time from 8 trips, used only 2, asked for my refund 10 days ago, with full details.  Nothing. I work from home too as many of my colleagues: we deal with emails, requests, claims, calls in REAL time. No 5-10 working days wait!!! Why?  And they (GA) are not alone.  Holidays are coming, need extra money, but no reply from GA, no refund.  Not so keen to keep their  promises, I guess, all that TV ads cost a lot. Thank you for refunding me ASAP. 10.12.2021

items.title: Mid winter12 carriage train £5,000 a…
items.review_text: Mid winter12 carriage train £5,000 a year season ticket no heating again. Carriages completely cold. I have brought a snowball inside to keep warm .

items.title: An absolutely atrocious service
items.review_text: An absolutely atrocious service. Trains just moving slowly without an explanation then suddenly terminates at Colchester with an announcement 2 minutes beforehand. I ask office at Colchester station only to be informed that the train that I was on is going back to London, No consideration to the customers already on the train. It is only because I asked that is why I am aware . It is unfortunate that Greater Anglia has the service in this area because they are an absolute shambles. Personally I feel sorry for anyone that has to work for them. The most clueless train service that exists.

items.title: Can not fault the Greater Anglia…
items.review_text: Can not fault the Greater Anglia customer service, they went above and beyond to refund my tickets after I contracted COVID-19 a few days before I was due to travel. The process was very easy and the customer advisor was very caring of my situation.

items.title: Crooks
items.review_text: Glad to see most people have rated this lot with one star. I totally agree. Drive, cycle, walk, take the bus just don’t use the services of this bunch of crooks. Even after putting a rail replacement service on they still can’t run the connecting train on time and if you try to get your money back they’ll use any little gotcha to get out of it.

items.title: I Hate You Alan
items.review_text: As an avid user of greater anglia- the experience can be summed up in three words. Unreliable, Unpredictable, Scammy. If you enjoy remaining on the edge of your seat wondering whether you’ll ever reach your destination or be dumped in a random field, and if you enjoy being sneered out by conductors that act like they own the whole rail line, then this is the trainline for you. And Alan if you’re reading, just know that I will be prowling then Greater Anglia lines untill I get my revenge in the form of £8.70.

items.title: totally crap.
items.review_text: totally crap.. You cannot trust them, delays and cancellations every single day.. you can lose your flight easily.. you can be late at work easily..Also fix the wifi, it is 2021 and your wifi doesn't work, unbelievable..

items.title: The ticket inspectors were very rude
items.review_text: The ticket inspectors were very rude. Asked for my ticket under a tunnel so my 4G was not working (I bought it on my phone) and were accusing me of lying. The man got in my face without wearing a mask which is a violation of covid guidelines too. Very unprofessional. Didn’t even apologise when my ticket finally loaded.

items.title: Just want to thank Lisa from London…
items.review_text: Just want to thank Lisa from London Liverpool Street , ticket /customer care , she was so friendly and helpful , huge credit to your company , also her manager who was just as lovely but I did not catch her name .

items.title: Witham, Thank you Chris!
items.review_text:
Just want to say a huge thank you to Chris at witham station who saw me attempting to carry my suitcase up the stairs and came out of his office space to come and carry it for me. He is a great asset to the company. 
Also loving the new trains that have been invested in (:

items.title: Disgusting company
items.review_text: Disgusting company. They take money for first class fares but never have first class carriages, claiming the money back is a very long winded and time consuming process. The staff are rude, the trains are dirty and there are rarely any refreshments available. If I ran this shower of a company I would hang my head in shame. Why oh why is the franchise bit taken off them.

items.title: Worst company in existence
items.review_text: Worst company in existence. Overpriced manky old trains that are always delayed. And literally every other week is rail replacement bus.  What could possibly be wrong with the trains for it to be bus replacements so often?? Absolute useless service, waste of money.

items.title: Disgusting condition
items.review_text:
On a train from
Cambridge to London. Beyond disgusted from the level of cleanliness. How is it possible that these trains are allowed to run? I want a refund!

items.title: I'd urge the government not to renew their contract.
items.review_text:
82% negative reviews and this company is still being paid by the public purse. Unbelievable.
Touched in at goodmayes station go to southend ending up having to pay a penalty fare. No announcement or notices at Shenfield that I buy an additional ticket beyond shenfied. 
Complainted to Greater London just were'nt interested, they refused discloses how money  (£1000's) the company has genereating by misinforming passengers and issuing penalty fare. I'd urge the government not to renew their contract.

items.title: I purchased a season ticket for my son…
items.review_text:
I purchased a season ticket for my son to travel to college and he lost the smart card that it was loaded onto. The smart card system is supposed to make it quick and easy to replace a card that has been lost. The whole system doesn’t work at all. Four different members of staff have been unable or unwilling to help me and all have given different reasons and explanations.
- The first member of staff at the ticket office in Ely said it would cost £20 for a replacement and that this had to be done online.
- The member of staff from the telephone helpline said that all I needed to do was to order a new smart card for free and take it along to my ticket office with details of the season ticket and that they would fix it for me.
- The next member of staff at Ely station refused to help at all (I followed all of the instructions given above) and he refused to help (despite me showing him the information on Greater Anglia’s own website saying that he should do).
- I then had to phone up GreaterAnglia again and ask for them to email Ely Station and tell them to re-issue the season ticket. They were apologetic as they confirmed that Ely ticket office should have done this for me already.
- The following day I turned up at Ely station and they had not been sent an email, they phoned Greater Anglia and it was confirmed that the member of staff had forgotten to send the email.
- Despite my son’s season ticket appearing on his Greater Anglia account when he logs in online they apparently have no record of it or of the transaction, even though they can see the season ticket on his account, so they refuse to do anything more to help.

The system just doesn’t work at all, there is no joined up thinking, no customer service, no staff training and no ability to help customers or replace lost season tickets.

After 2 weeks of trying to get this sorted I have finally given up - the system is broken!

items.title: Recent business trip from Gt Yarmouth…
items.review_text: Recent business trip from Gt Yarmouth to Brighton & petrified of the underground I met the lovely Ann at the ticket office in Gt Yarmouth who went up and above suggesting different routes with no tube involved…. Customers were piling up behind me so said I would come back after work.  Upon arrival she had searched all routes plus best price for me. I took her advice going via Farringdon, 3 stops & only 1 tiny tunnel in darkness …… so proud & huge thanks Ann xx

items.title: So was at clacton and had an emergency…
items.review_text:
So was at clacton and had an emergency to go back to london 
Greater anglia not only left me half way to take bus but charged me twice  for a train ticket 
Very unprofessional  and non reliable 
So frustrated and depressed alone girl at night

items.title: Very poor customer service
items.review_text: On a trip back from London to bishops stortford the last train was cancelled leaving us stranded. The only employee on the platform was useless and could not help us or advise us whatsoever. We had to take to twitter and they told us that if the station staff could not help us we could get a taxi home and claim a refund which we did. I then contacted greater anglia by email to claim my refund and after 2 weeks I go a reply saying they would look into the reasons why the train was cancelled and get back to me. Quite frankly I dont care why it was cancelled I just want to be refunded my £120 taxi fare. Their reply implied I was lying about the cancelled train, whereas  surely they should know what trains they have cancelled. I'm still waiting for my refund. Very poor customer service.

items.title: Absolute joke of a service
items.review_text:
Absolute joke of a service. Constant delays, awful customer service, never apologetic and  3 of their staff members actually had the audacity to shout at me aggressively when I told them the service was bad. 
If I could give a 0 I would. 
Would never recommend to anyone and they charge you through the roof. 
I spend 5k a year for commute into London for the worst service I have ever witnessed. Just terrible.

items.title: Well done Greater Anglia!!
items.review_text:
My partner and I had tickets to Norwich but we got our times wrong and arrived too late to travel.
Went to ticket office to get new tickets which should have cost £117!!
Lady in the ticket office (Viviein) was amazing and got us on the next train for no extra charge!! Well done Greater Anglia and well done to Viviein!! You proved that there are still some lovely people in this rather strange world at the moment!! Top marks 😃👍

items.title: £55 extra to travel on an empty train
items.review_text:
Paid for ticket online from Milton Keynes to Ipswich which was all good till i boarded an near empty train at Liverpool Street to Ipswich. Get as far as Manningtree and train still empty when ticket inspector comes and wants to charge an extra £55 because i got on the 7.00am instead of the 7.30am. 

It clearly states on ticket its a peak time ticket which 7.00 and 7.30 are but nope you must pay more 

The whole train network service in the UK is beyond a joke and needs renationalising quickly as these private providers are just fleecing the public for as much as they can

items.title: One only has to look at the reviews and…
items.review_text:
One only has to look at the reviews and see that 83% are bad (the lowest) and 10% the excellent service, the remaining 7% in-between. This alone suggests the service is not fit for purpose.

A lot has been said about staff and again it is probably only 10% that actually care. The rest I have encountered are rude, unhelpful and just want to be chatting to their chums or be on a mobile phone. That's if there are members of staff not to help you, sometimes there is not a single member of staff. 

I now do not travel on the GA service for days out as a majority of the weekends have maintenance on at least one part of the track which means I have to take a replacement bus for the same price. Strange how during work time and non holidays the service is up because they can fleece the workforce out of thousands. 

Lots of stations are not manned after a certain time so people can travel free and it's annoying when you need help but they have all gone home to bed. Lovely service. Thanks for your lack of customer service.

I travel mostly by bus at weekends as it is cheaper and most of the time I will have to anyway with rail works. I can understand all the negativity and hostile reviews towards this company as they richly deserve them and are a horrendous company where we are not customers, just statistics. Don't bother with legitimate refunds as the hassle is not worth it. Just find out what stations are often not manned and have a few freebies.

Update on 19/12/22

items.title: Norwich to London
items.review_text: We recently took a train from Norwich to London via Cambridge. At Cambridge we realised we had to upgrade our tickets . The only person on the platform was a driver named Luke . This man went way beyond his duties took us to ticket office and back to platform to continue our journey . This man is a credit to Greater Anglia . We would like you to pass on our thanks.  Employee of the month we think . Excellent service 👍

items.title: Got to white Hart Lane Station
items.review_text: Got to white Hart Lane Station.  10 minutes before train..  Gate closed.  Train comes and goes.. Gate open.  No train.  Another 30 minutes to wait. Muppets shouting.  I find it hard to stand for all that time.  It's a waste of time and money doing up the station.  Why are there no trains.  It needs a local service like other towns..  Might as well close the station with no trains.

items.title: Very very BAD,never buy ticket from…
items.review_text:
Very very BAD,never buy ticket from they are robbing in day light.
i bought a ticket from liverpool street to luton to get a main train for luton you have go kings cross  which takes 15 mint,luton trains cancel twice(ech train comes after 25mint) i ask for refund at kingscross they said i have to go liverpool for refund it took me 15 mint getting back to liverpool street station,i ask for refund she said we offer refund within hour & i was 15 mint late which isn't mention on ticket or receipt,she said claim online i call them but not helpful i submit form online no response.
 i was buying ticket from them every week but not anymore

items.title: Layla
items.review_text: My train to Stockport was cancelled at the last minute on the 25th August due to unforeseen circumstances which caused me stress and inconvenience. However a young lady called Layla came to the rescue who did her best to assist me, even carrying my case for me. Please convey my thanks to Layla for her kindness and dedication.

items.title: Avoid. Avoid. Avoid.
items.review_text:
Staffed by an inarticulate band of process obsessed drones, this company raises bureaucracy and inhumanity to absurd heights. I fear I’ve forever lost a part of my soul by trying to reason with them.

A stone-faced and callous refusal to let me through the gates when I’d misplaced my ticket, despite me being able to produce the receipt. 

They forced me buy a second ticket for a considerable sum, and then I had to run around in circles with a customer service rep who’s idea of reasoning with me was him barking insults. 

This review won’t give me my £20 back, but venting in public forums is all we — the humble customer — have. 

This company is a plague that should be wiped from the face of the earth.

items.title: We had to get a new ticket to add on to…
items.review_text: We had to get a new ticket to add on to our journey and Luke (a driver) took time out of his long day and assisted us to make sure we had our new tickets on time and even saved us money !thank you Luke

items.title: How do they keep getting away with it?
items.review_text:
Travelling on Sundays takes four times longer than normal with a highly stressful detour via Mark's Tey, Newbury Park and the tube. Do we pay any less for that? - of course not. These 'maintenance works' from Mark have streched on for years now. 
Neither will they synchronize the departures with the Harwich ferry. One can wait at the small station for at least an hour.

The cherry on top is the fact they have the audacity to increase the price in January whilst the service slowly worsens, year in, year out. **Whilst wages stagnate.** The new trains STILL breakdown despite the annual price hike. Complaints too are met with dismissive and patronising responses.

If a nobody in a track suit did to my money what these guys do every year they'd be put away - and rightly so.

items.title: New GA trains terrible seats
items.review_text: New GA trains. Very good, however the seats are simply awful, rock hard and a journey from norwich to Stratford, caused me severe back pain. So I am afraid, GA, only one star.

items.title: Poor seating
items.review_text: My daughter has to use this service when she comes back to visit Suffolk. She has always remarked on how incredibly uncomfortable the seating is, made worse by having back problems. It is astonishing that a new fleet of trains should contain such an obvious design fault, but not surprising these days. I note that quite a number of contributors have said the same. I think I'll give them a miss! Unfortunate for those who have no choice.

items.title: Customer Service.
items.review_text: I contacted Greater Anglia customer service regarding a problematic refund. They were absolutely excellent, going beyond anything that they may have been legally required to do. All the staff I dealt with were pleasant and polite, but I would give a special mention to Aiden as he dealt directly with my email.

items.title: Delay Repay site is the pits
items.review_text:
I am absolutely appalled by the delay repay sub-site for Greater Anglia. I submitted a claim to them in July for a valid delay of 30 mins. First of all they rejected the claim because as they claim the ticket had not been spoiled; which was not true, as it had. Secondly, they then rejected the claim as I had not added the entire journey from Paignton to Bishops Stortford rather than just the segment which was delayed. The website would not allow me to add my journey, because although I had taken a perfectly valid route on an advance ticket, there search facility would only find journeys via Westbury, which meant I could not add the journey as per the ticket.

This website is awful and the customer service in processing the delays could be said to be purposely awkward to discourage customers from having to ever make a claim thereby saving money for the TOC.

items.title: My mum uses this service to get from…
items.review_text: My mum uses this service to get from Stansted to Reading. Outrageous. There is always a problem. Extortionate amount of money charged. Get a cab if you can.

items.title: absolutely raging
items.review_text: absolutely raging. NO CHARGING PORTS ON A 5 HOUR TRAIN JOURNEY. 😭😭😭😭 not very swag

items.title: Terrible service always late and never…
items.review_text:
Terrible service always late and never on time
What's wrong with you
21st century, internet, technology etc
Very archaic still
Progress avoided you somehow

items.title: Lovely helpful lady!!
items.review_text: I am writing this review because it’s my first time using this service I needed to travel from bishop stortford to London Liverpool Street! I came and brought my ticket. The station is huge; I was very overwhelmed and confused I asked this lady at bishop stortford it was around 7.53 this Morning! I wish I got her name! She was a blonde lady and had her hair in a pony tail! She was soo helpful told me exactly when the train was coming and what platform it would be on! She told me to wait in the comfortable waiting room where I had a lovely hot chocolate and the man who made it was delightful too! She then came and collected me before my train was arriving and told me to have a lovely day! These people never get enough recognition! Thankyou! X

items.title: Absolutely disgusting service!
items.review_text:
Absolutely disgusting service!

I appreciate that things go wrong sometimes, especially in bad weather conditions, but the way passengers were treated yesterday at Harlow Town is an absolute disgrace. No information whatsoever, the staff locked themselves in the closet, after a while they came out panicked giving the misleading advice, like: take taxi, don't travel, or go to Stansted (but figure yourself out how-to). We later learned that we would not be reimbursed for the cars that we organized ourselves. Phone line? Forget it, if you get through, you could only get some BS from the script. No practical information on how to get home at all. There were families with kids, young teenagers left out in the middle of the night at the station which (as if it wasn't enough) was surrounded by sketchy individuals that security was helpless about...
Absolute lack of crisis management skills, every respectable business can at least put a minimum effort into this.

Their motto is "Travel with confidence". I'd add: "Travel with confidence that we do not care".

items.title: Dumping families with no help
items.review_text:
If I could give 0 stars, I would. We were dumped along with so many other people (also families with toddlers) in Harlow Town on the 25th July at 7pm with no replacement busses or information on how to get back home. 

We were advised to get a taxi and claim the money back. After calling customer service line, we were told that we wouldn't get the full refund for the taxi which at that time was 300 pounds!

The customer service staff at the station were advised by management to tell passengers to "not travel". We were told that the management called an emergency "conference call" but no information whatsoever about what was decided. No information about the replacement busses. No communication. 

I feel for the customer service staff at the station as they didn't receive any useful advice from the top management and couldn't help.

The worst service ever. Dumping families with no help. Shame.

items.title: London floods July 2021
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusted with how greater anglia treated its members of public yesterday, Sunday 25th July 2021,hundreds were dumped at Harlow Town train station with no form of replacement transport to get back to Norwich and surrounding areas, most had managed to get transport but others hadn't, so myself and friend rang greater anglia and spoke on and off for almost 5 hrs trying to get transport for everyone, I could not believe that nothing was put in place, a young 17 Yr old partially deaf lad had been there since 4.30pm!! We helped him and lots of female students and 2 young female Dr's, we got them to stay with us as they were very distressed, in total around 30 plus people were still at the station, my friend managed to get taxis sorted via Billy at greater anglia,for the remaining public only to be REFUSED by the 'staff member' at Harlow Town Station, I tried all local taxi firms, rang young coaches and Greater anglia 0345 number(spoke with the amazing Billy) as did my my friend, the Staff member at Harlow lied saying we were getting a coach, but nothing was arranged, I had to arrange it myself, only 2 coaches had been allocated but not to come to Harlow!! Greater Anglia have no respect for the public at all, they just want the money, and they need to sort out customer service training for their staff members!!! Not happy at all!!

items.title: Appreciate the extra effort to make things right
items.review_text:
We were supposed to travel with the last service from Sheringham to Cambridge via Norwich. Due to an accident at a level crossing between Salhouse and Hoveton & Wroxham, the service was cancelled at the last minute. The digital info board displayed a "limited bus replacement" service (whatever that meant). It wasn't clear when and from where that bus would depart.

Minutes later, we noticed a bus in the nearby station, operated by Sanders Coaches, which ended up super-crowded (dubbed the COVID-bus by one of the passengers). Initially, we thought it was the replacement service and got on in a hurry. The driver did not answer our question regarding this detail, just bluntly stating how much we have to pay. With many tourists travelling from Sheringham and Cromer to Norwich, the bus was so crowded that after a while it did not stop, so many people (possibly some of them were regular commuters?) were left in the bus stations between Cromer and Norwich (I feel sorry for them). Of course, the 44A service is not passing near the Norwich train station and on top of that had a slight delay, so we got off at the closest bus stop and tried to run to the train station, arriving at 22:43, so just missing the last train service to Cambridge by 3 minutes.

I explained our situation to a young lady at the Greater Anglia info desk. No questions asked, she said she will call us a taxi, just wait on the benches. After around half an hour, a taxi was waiting for us, so we got back to Cambridge just 40 minutes later than expected. Given the confusion around the replacement bus service, we were kind of put up with the idea that we will have to sort out our journey back for ourselves (apparently something that the other passengers did). It was a huge and pleasant surprise to hear that Greater Anglia will ensure that we reach our destination.

Would like to say a big thank you to the young lady and gentleman who were at the info desk in Norwich Station on the night of 17 July 2021 and sorted things out while keeping us updated. We have used Greater Anglia services many dozens of times, and it was the first time we faced a train cancellation. We're glad that they stepped in and made an extra effort to get us home safely (they could simply say: sorry).

items.title: Absolute disgrace of a service
items.review_text: Absolute disgrace of a service, I use this USELESS service every second weekend, and if you don't have to change 1500 times due to pathetic engineering works for 51 weeks of the year then your guaranteed to be delayed, without a shadow of a doubt you will be subject to useless delays and USELESS staff not having a clue what day it is yet alone the reason why. Absolute sick of using this service. I'd rather walk over hot coals getting spat on by a camal and getting shat on by a rhino then use this moron service. I mean how difficult is it. Absolute morons. Morons, no other word for the people that run this USELES service then MORONS. The customer service is about as useful as a pair of sunglasses to a man with one ear.

items.title: Thank you for your kindness
items.review_text: Was very late arriving at LST from Bristol yesterday after boarding at 12 pm. The Lady at both 1 was very kind and changed my ticket so l could catch the 4.30 going via Ipswich without having to pay for a new ticket. On boarding the train a lovely lady member of staff saw that l had a bad leg and sat me down comfortably before going to the Buffet for some water and a sandwich for me. This was above and beyond by both staff members. Thank you

items.title: I recently had smart card issues and…
items.review_text:
I recently had smart card issues and bought a Flexi season ticket that did not load onto a smart card.

The women in customer services stated it was a technical glitch which was being sorted and fully refunded my season ticket.

items.title: Lindsay the absolute angel
items.review_text: I was running late to catch my train from Norwich to London Liverpool & Lindsay helped me out so much, an absolute angel!!!! Good karma pending xx

If any train on my 5hr journey get delayed or make me late, it's rarely with GA. Also the staff were really nice at Norwich!

items.title: Greater Anglias angel

I will never forget the kindness she showed to me (if you are that lady who helped me at the train station in diss and you see this I hope you have an amazing life you are an  incredible human being).

items.title: Service

items.review_text:
Charging 50 pounds one way from london to darsham on dilapidated commuter trains is disgraceful.  If you are operating sub standard carriages then surely it should be a lower price?!?!

I don’t understand how they are allowed to operate this franchise.

items.title: Disgusting train
items.review_text: Traveling on the 12.05 10/06/2021 Liverpool Street to Ipwich The train Iam on is probably the most disgusting dirty smelly train I have ever been on, I have traveled on trains in so called third world countries that are cleaner ! This is the 2nd leg of my journey ,was on a Thameslink train first  and that was like a palace compared to this ! I paid £68 to travel most of my journey feeling sick because of the smell and the fifth .Totally unexcepable !

items.title: Always delayed or cancelled over priced…
items.review_text: Always delayed or cancelled over priced rubbish trains might as well take bus

items.title: Train company??
items.review_text:
Train company? Your having a laugh more like a bus company.  

NO Trains, overpriced.

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text:
I travelled on Greater Anglia on 31st May between Romford and Chelmsford. When I was at Romford, I was forced to wait for a train for up to 30 mins. This train was then further delayed by a couple of minutes. I managed to get to Shenfield where I had to change for a train to Chelmsford. At Shenfield, there was no information whatsoever of where I had to board the train to Chelmsford. When I boarded the Chelmsford train, I was forced to stand due to a lack of available seats. 

When I was coming back from Chelmsford, the train arriving for London was delayed. To my surprise, the train was packed as there was a signalling fault in Norwich. I couldn't find a seat once I boarded the train so I had to stand. The train then stopped at Ingatestone which was an non-intended stop. This was due to a fault with the tracks at the level crossing. 

The fare which I paid for my journey to and from Chelmsford does not reflect the standard of the service which Greater Anglia offers. Instead this service is more of a reflection of how trains run in a third world improvised country.

items.title: When I entered the station it was 18.23…
items.review_text: When I entered the station it was 18.23 and my train was 18.25.  but the train was already gone and I had to wait an extra half hour, it's too bad they got late in the morning and left before the hour :(

items.title: Just awful
items.review_text: Just awful. Cancelled my train last minute at 10pm in the middle of nowhere, I had to fork over 60 pounds , more than my day's wages, for a taxi home, upon doing so I emailed them to ask for compensation. When this was done they refused to pay as 'I hadn't sought out help from a station worker' despite the fact that I did so and couldn't find a single station worker. Truly shoddy. Stay away, you're better off going on foot.

items.title: I was trying to contact customer…
items.review_text: I was trying to contact customer service. I was first on the line . I waist 1hour on the phone and no answer

items.title: Fantastic onboard customer service was…
items.review_text: Fantastic onboard customer service was fully accommodating with my disability staff very polite and professional

items.title: Disgraceful delay repay.
items.review_text:
Disgraceful delay repay.
We missed our connection because their train doors wouldn't open. This caused a delay of 30 minutes.
I had to fill out their online delay replay forms twice as there were two of us. It is onerous and needs not only photo pictures of the tickets but also to read and type in the same print numbers on the actual tickets and to know the exact train departure times.
Having done all of this their delay repay rejected the delay.  I can only imagine the train driver or system to not log the delay due to their doors not opening.
All I get is a form email to tell me to raise the complaint to their generic email box

It is disgraceful that they will not process this. And that they throw so many barriers in the way of legitimate customers who have to deal with their poorly run network.

items.title: Where do you start
items.review_text: It's a shame there is not a option for 0 stars as I think possibly this company could win an award for UK's worst business. I mean where do you start, if I was to write everything that is wrong with this train line this would go on forever. The trains are never clean, they are late numerous times making me late for my shifts in the hospital, they have decided to reduce the service to Liverpool Street but yet decide to put the price up during the pandemic, they are hugely over priced to name of a few things. Compared to other countries why do we offer such a bad service when it comes to trains?

items.title: WHERE DO I START
items.review_text:
WHERE DO I START

Greater Anglia, bad service 
Dirty trains 
High prices for a bad service 
I regularly commute from Stratford to Colchester, and the trains are non stop filthy, strong smell of wee, sticky floors and a avalanche of dust when you sit on the seats!!! The ticket inspectors talk down to you and honestly they need to be sacked. The other day a ticket inspector got on at shenfield, she was very rude, has short hair(purple colour) and she aggressively asked me for my ticket and she was not even wearing a mask!! If I could give this 0 stars I would, ticket inspectors are rude! 
Trains are old 
Don’t wear your best outfit because it will get covered in dust when you sit down. Their are always delayed, cancellations. Oh yeah a person got hit by a train at Chelmsford around 11PM I was travelling back from Colchester to Stratford, and their was no trains going to Liverpool st, a lot of people were stranded as they were not providing a rail replacement bus and only a small minority of Colchester taxis were willing to drive to London. 

I hope greater Anglia go buss and fail!!

items.title: Thank you to the two lovely ladies at…
items.review_text: Thank you to the two lovely ladies at Newbury Park station covering the rail replacement for greater anglia on Saturday Easter weekend. Sharon and Justine you were so lovely and helpful after I turned up on my bike.

items.title: Why is the GA App so dreadful
items.review_text: Yet again the App has failed to let my son buy a weekly season ticket - a completely white screen. Yes, he did try turning it off and on again!

items.title: Absolute joke of a company.
items.review_text:
Absolute joke of a company.

The prices they charge are completely unjustified, and they wonder why they have so many problems with fare skippers. £16.60 a DAY to go from Manningtree > Clacton return. There is NO JUSTIFICATION for these prices AT ALL. A bus would cost you £6, driving even less, and these robbers get away with that price!! The london commute is always a laugh too, £50 a day to sit on the floor of a train with too few carriages - especially during COVID. This company is a greedy bunch of people who only care about money and not their customers. They deny refund claims when their service is awful  - filthy trains, delays, cancellations, power hungry, bullied in school ticket inspectors who talk down to you. They charge obscene prices, provide poor customer service, poor service overall, and frankly need to be removed from operating any services. One word to sum Greater Anglia up = See you next tuesdays.

items.title: Dont get the App it does not work!!!
items.review_text: I purchased a ticket via the new App. I was sent an email to confirm my purchase but the app is refusing to download the ticket and says to contact them!!! Good luck with that one. I could raise the dead with more ease. The system works perfectly taking your cash but need help and you get an email saying they will reply in 10 days. I was meant to travel tomorrow! Absolute shambles and a disgrace. First planned train journey in years and most definetly the last.

items.title: As if the engineering work are not enough
items.review_text:
Where to start! 
I am a key worker therefore I have to travel. Yesterday I took the 20,53 from Cambridge North to London to work a night shift. Possibly in the third world people travel in better condition. Filthy, dirty, worn out, broken, beyond imagination.
After my night shift I went to Liverpool Street Ststion to get the replacement coach to Stansted Airport in order to get the train back home. The coach broke down even before we had left, so we had to move to the replacement of the replacement. Arrived at Stansted I had  to run to get the 8:16 and (surprise!) it was cancelled. Now I am seated on the 8:45.
ETD 6:40 (ishishish) ETA...whenever.

items.title: The train service is one of the worst…
items.review_text: The train service is one of the worst in London constantly changing train times with no notifications even down to totally removing trains at the time your used to again with no notifications then you get used to the 47 mins past servive again they change that too with no notifications then want to to stand and wait half hour then change at Tottenham hale and wait another half hour for a train that used to go straight to your station??? Almost seems this service does what it wants and doesn't care for there customers or work times etc... I strongly advice you avoid this service if possible.

items.title: The repayment reclaim is quick and…
items.review_text: The repayment reclaim is quick and effective.

items.title: Was abandoned in the freezing cold at…
items.review_text: Was abandoned in the freezing cold at 11.30pm in the middle of the countryside by the replacement bus service provided and told there was a 2nd bus to take me the rest of the way, which never arrived. Kept calling to be told it was running late then after an hour was told I would have to find my own way home. Had to walk 8 mile and ended up having an asthma attack. My complaint hasn't been taken seriously even tho I have recordings of me ringing them in the middle of the night. Not even refunded my ticket.

items.title: A happy Greater Anglia customer
items.review_text: I use the trains and stations of Greater Anglia on a regular basis and I am quite satisfied with them on the whole. Most staff are friendly and helpful, the trains are typically clean and more and more of them are brand new. While tickets are ridiculously expensive in general, Greater Anglia regularly offers some great deals (unlike some of their competitors). Their mobile app is also the best I have ever used across the country.

items.title: Great customer service, swift responses and quick refunds
items.review_text:
My son uses Greater Anglia to commute to school to Chelmsford from Stratford. So far, I have contacted Greater Anglia quite a few times and every time I have received swift responses and every attempt was made to resolve my issue.  Figuring out the optimal fare was, I must admit, an arduous task at the beginning because we had London zones 3-6 to be added to the mix.  After quite a few conversations with GA phone support, figured out paper travelcard was the only way which must be bought each time in person from a station. Barring that one inconvenience, his experience of greater anglia so far has been great. and as for me, i have so far contacted them twice , once  for delay refund claim . I filled the form online which was acknowledged same day and refund processed next day. Next we bought one month ticket in advance  and then government announced staggered return so we were informed he would be starting school a week later. I contacted GA via email, they responded quickly , offered full refund and advised the best way to obtain the new ticket. I was asked to cut my ticket in half and send image to them. I did as advised and refund was processed immediately.
Thank you Rachael , Vivyan and others from Greater Anglia customer service team for your brilliant support.

items.title: BEWARE of travelling to Chelmsford from…
items.review_text: BEWARE of travelling to Chelmsford from Shenfield. It appears to be a scam. Greater Anglia unnecessarily penalise over 1000 passengers a month. While I travelled to Chelmsford, tapping in with my debit card with every intention to tap out at Chelmsford I found I was unable to.  When I approached a ticket guard I was aggressively told that I would have to be charged a penalty for travelling without a ticket. No understanding and no discretion. When I returned and spoke to the Shenfield office they told me it was a common mistake. While there is no clear messaging and if you regularly travel to London, you quite understandably might make the same mistake. So please help stop feeding their pot.

items.title: Design Failure
items.review_text:
I travel regularly from London to Lowestoft.
I have been for over 20years.
Without Doubt the Seats on the New Trains are the Most Uncomfortable I have ever experienced in Any Train 
Apart from Poor Seat Padding the Design pushes you forward into a most Uncomfortable Position.
The First Class, if it ever runs !, Is No more Comfortable.
Designed by Who ? Children ?
Then there's the Ludicrous Sinks in the Toilets.
Impossible not to get Water on the Floor.
It's Such a pity that All this Money has been Spent and the Comfort of the Customer is Being Ignored.. The Trains look Good but the Overall Design is a Failure. Including the Crazy position of the Computer Plugs.
I now am Traveling Much Less as There is Absolutely No Enjoyment to the Journey.

items.title: Don't expect any discretion, they are robots.
items.review_text:
I made an honest mistake,travelling from Brentwood  to Chelmsford. I hardly ever go to Chelmsford, I usually go to Romford,and forgot  the zone finishes at Shenfield. Then it's Greater Anglian, Joy! I went to tap out with my bank card, and when it didn't  work wondered why. I turned around  to  speak to one of the 3 staff standing  around and one walked away! I managed to drag the other one away from chatting  and found out my card wouldn't  work because I was out of the tfl zone, in Chelmsford.I was told I had to pay a penalty fare. I tried to explain that I haven't  been to Chelmsford in over a year and just forgot,offering to buy a return ticket at the ticket  office.The staff can use their discretion,( I read later) but there was no chance of this. I was polite, giving my correct details, the employee said I stood a good chance of not paying the fine ,as I didn't  have any previous fines....surprise! He said he had to treat everyone the same, but if you do that, you cannot 
use your discretion! I  just received a standard  e-mail response to my appeal declining it. They clearly are just out to get as much money  as possible, and there is NO room for manoeuvre. Maybe if I was the Queen? I dislike this non customer  service intensely. I think the staff have too much time on their hands,as they were all standing about,and I hope they get taken  over by a better company, to put it mildly.Yes, they don't  even deserve one star.

items.title: Great issue resolution
items.review_text:
My train was delayed and I had an issue processing the refund form.

The lady from customer services chased me about the refund. Great service and more than makes up for the delay due to trespassers.
Thank you

items.title: Terrible and ripped off.
items.review_text: Purchased a first class ticket from London Liverpool Street to Norwich. No first class seat available. Horrible dirty carriage with strobe lighting, giving migraines. Suffered the whole way. Trolley service ran down corridor not wanting to engage. Originally notice board had said no catering available. Should not state have first class available if cant provide. Rip off. They need to learn from Greater Western who provide a fantastic service with nice staff. Travelled with them in the morning - what a difference.

items.title: Awful, appalling and no help or information
items.review_text:
Awful, appalling service of only redeemed by the excellent caring help of two off duty staff members!

The train took 2 hours 30 mins to get from Liverpool st to Shenfield, then another 30 to get to Colchester where the train just stopped and we had to get off - no apology. There was no heating on and one toilet for 10 carriages. I think the train was about 1950's all battered outside and filthy.I assume that the shiny new electric trains have packed up. Apparently all available drivers had gone over their hours due to massive signalling problems all day so nobody was available to drive our train - yet someone was driving it and he just got off and vanished.
There were 6 seats for all of the elderly, disabled and those with young children - 3 if they socially distanced and it was freezing standing on the platform. Nobody came to help us or tell us what was going on.
Eventually, we spotted an off duty staff member and he helped us!! 10/10 he was so caring when nobody else was! He was googling what was going on himself! A train came into the station and was commandeered to take us to Ipswich - but those going to Norwich would have to get off at Ipswich.
A driver volunteered to drive the train although he had gone over his hours and would be stuck in Ipswich when he didn't live there. 10/10 to them and 0/10 for Greater Anglia.
So we managed to get home 4 hour hours after we left London!! It used to take an hour with steam trains in Victorian times.

items.title: The most terrible app
items.review_text: The most terrible app - doesn’t work staff at the station acknowledge this but still make you buy another ticket - appalling service. If there was an alternative everyone would use it but typical public authority - nobody cares! Dreadful

items.title: Doubling fare for mistakenly touching in
items.review_text:
I touched in at Tottenham Hale to take the train to Stansted rather than buy a ticket. As Gatwick and Heathrow use touch in I thought it was the same. There were no signs stating that I would be charged double  for this mistake.

Upon arriving arriving at the airport a Stansted express employee explained to me that I would have to pay double without any recourse to buying online there and then. And that I should have read about it online before travel with a smile on her face.

Lining up behind me were another 10 people who did the same thing. Standard Express /greater anglia employees gave a business as usual explanation to everyone, cashing in at every turn. Clearly this is not a one off mistake and Stansted express are making substantial sums with this strategy.

I understand that there may be some cost to paying at the airport but doubling the price is a rouse to extorting poor customers who were simply not informed with signs. A fiver would have been acceptable but doubling is extortionate.

Greater Anglia have not provided a refund as they are an effective monopoly and can do whatever they wish.

items.title: I arrived at Ipswich train station and…
items.review_text: I arrived at Ipswich train station and I am not use to using trains and was travelling to London alone.  I was unsure what to do as I had to catch a bus to Witham.  I was helped by a lovely lady called Theresa.  She went above and beyond to help me. Her colleague took me to the bus stop and then Theresa brought me a printed sheet with times and where to go with also return times.  It was so kind of her and it made my journey really enjoyable knowing that she cared for my wellbeing.  Thank you Theresa

items.title: Zero stars
items.review_text: Of course one has to put a star to be able to review but I actually think this company should be sued for fraudulent behaviour. After a four hour delay on one of their trains from London to Norwich in Friday 25/09/20 , I processed a claim to get my money back AS SUGGESTED BY THE TRAIN CONDUCTOR. I received 10 EMAILS with various reasons to reject the claim until the last, when I was asked for cut the tickets in half and send a picture. Then I got a reply that tickets were not sufficiently DEFACED. I know that plenty of companies go to great lengths to avoid paying for unbelievably shoddy service ... but these guys should be given an award just for the sheer lack of decency they display

items.title: useless
items.review_text: the trains never bloody turn up took me 3 hours to to get hospital yesterday!!!!!!!! they pinch your money with expropriated ticket prices and then provide a 0 star service, the workers are useless and rude at the stations, which is the cherry on top

items.title: Bikes are not welcome
items.review_text:
I'm shocked with how backwards and fussy the bike policy of "Greater" Anglia is. A huge hassle to get a place on a train, because there are supposedly no spaces available on that train I wanted to book. So I needed to make tons of changes to my trip, also meaning that I need to book much more expensive train tickets, so I could get on a train with a place for my bike –– but then, once I board the train I booked, THERE IS NO SPACE or FACILITIES for ANY BIKE!!! Shocking! What was all the fuss about?! Absolutely ridiculous.

To make matters even worse, all the toilets on the train were out of order.

items.title: refund is extremely slow
items.review_text: refund is extremely slow, not transparent and you cannot check status as well. Not up to any decent company's standard, not to mention regional railway company. Its a disgrace really.

items.title: Refund service is terrible
items.review_text:
Refund service is terrible. We bought a return ticket from Liverpool street to Stansted airport, but as out flight returns to Gatwick instead we only needed the first leg of the journey. 

We called the customer service and they said that to get a refund we needed to buy a new ticket for the single leg. Only then we would have got a full refund of the initial return journey. 

So that's what we did but then when we called again they asked us to submit a refund by email. This is a very long-winded process for something that should be much simpler.

items.title: Poor refund service
items.review_text: Poor refund service, sent email still no reply or refund.

items.title: Reduced frequency of trains during rush hour!!!
items.review_text: Normally trains run twice an hour, but Greater Anglia decides to reduce that to once an hour during rush hour when people need to get home to their families. That does not make sense! Hackney Downs to Ponders End:  One train running at 1733-1744 which I can't catch because I can't reach the train station before then, and then next train runs at 1833-1844, and if that gets delayed/cancelled then I am screwed.  The shareholders of the company probably have chauffeur driven cars, they don't have any concerns about the average person.

items.title: Very satisfied indeed!! 5 stars!!
items.review_text: Have to say, my experience today made me want to write a glowing report!! Immaculate train.... looked new which can only be a good thing right? On time too so no complaints from me. Keep it up!!

items.title: The worst website I have ever used when…
items.review_text:
The worst website I have ever used when trying to purchase a service. Do Greater Anglia ever read the trust pilot reviewS? I guess not. 
Customer service obviously is not their priority. You need to listen to customers reviews if you want to improve customer service.

items.title: Hate this company with a vengeance
items.review_text: Incompetence in every way possible, dirty trains, poor customer services, expensive fares and take ages to refund monies. Charge as much for a single fare as a return. Are daylight robbers and why the government allow this is beyond me. Unfortunately I have no choice but to use them because there's no other train companies where I live. Oh and then there's a £10 charge for any refunds which is absolutely ridiculous, for what exactly, they only press and few buttons. Oh and it took four months to get my Covid refund because they didn't check the refund details properly and had to get the ombudsman involved.

items.title: Only Used them because they accepted…
items.review_text:
Only Used them because they accepted paypal,booked an off peak day return for £8,did not use it ,tried to refund ,every time i clicked,it just went to a booking page,could not get anywhere tried for an hour.
It seems even if i did get anywhere there is a £10 charge,so absolute joke.

items.title: Still waiting for Covid Season Ticket Refund
items.review_text: I am still waiting for my Covid Season Ticket Refund after defacing my ticket and completing an online form over 3 months ago! I have been lucky that I have kept my job & working from home but I may have to go back to the office in September and I don't think they will accept "Offset the cost against what you owe me" as a method of payment for a new ticket! I can't get through on the phone. When I rarely get a reply to my email chasers even after being escalated to senior personnel, I am being told that they cannot chase this up, as will delay my refund even further and they are unable to advise how much longer I will have to wait. They need to update their website to acknowledge there are still many people like me still waiting for refunds for far more than the 56 days stated!

items.title: OMG i am disgraced

items.title: Something fishy going on @GA
items.review_text: I applied for my STL refund on 4th April but it still hasn’t been processed and it’s now 17th June. The online form l completed was filled out exactly as requested because otherwise it would not accept submission. I was then called approximately 28 days later by a lady to take my card details that l had already provided. She said she knew nothing about how long my refund would take and that all she had was a list of telephone numbers to call. Disappointed but understanding l wanted. Having read the GA website a number of times l took into account that it said l should wait up to a maximum 56 ‘calendar days’ before receiving said refund. Having not done so l called customer service who told me that it was in fact 56 working days not calendars day and she apologised for the websites inaccurate information. 2 weeks later l then receive an email saying that there has been a delay because l didn’t submit the photo of my ticket initially, well sorry GA but lm absolutely certain that l did, what was more worrying though was the fact that they again asked for my card details, telephone number for the 3rd time and the station l bought the ticket from a 2nd time. I’m sorry GA but it’s absolutely apparent that you are either losing/lost most of the information people have sent to you or you have the least integrated departmental systems that l have ever heard of, especially considering its 2020, not 1980. I’ve always been happy with your train service, and even though 80% of the staff l encounter at Liverpool Street station are unhelpful. However, whilst lm willing to be flexible given the situation it seems as though you are staggering your financial loses. If l don’t receive my refund by the 56 working days, I will spend the remainder of my time in lockdown contacting as many people as possible to see if they have a similar story and if so starting a petition online for an investigation into why exactly had happened. You might need the money GA but so do we.

items.title: An absolute joke

items.title: COVID refund policy a disgrace

COVID refund policy a disgrace, backdating 56 days only - WHY?  Well, when I asked all they said was, “all train operators are doing the same”. That is not an explanation that is a disgraceful lazy cop out.

Service is terrible whether you use it or not.  Thieves

items.title: Incorrect refund and no solution
items.review_text: I asked for my season ticket to be refunded in March and I was refunded an incorrect amount. I am still waiting for the rest of an annual ticket. Last email from them told me to send my bank details as they can not refund any other way. The most insecure method possible but the first refund attempt went direct to my card I used to pay originally. Why is it so difficult to get a refund after 2 months

items.title: I completely understand than due to…
items.review_text:
I completely understand than due to Covid-19, A LOT of people were refunding their tickets all at once and the pressure from this stretched thin systems already in place. Completely understand that and initially I was forgiving for it in spite of mixed messaging about refunds and admin charges in the beginning.

That was back in March. Now we're halfway through May and I have not received word or update back about my refund. Communication again remains Greater Anglia's biggest fault, alongside yearly price hikes that punish commuters. Although Covid-19 is a global pandemic, I have to admit I'm glad it gives me an excuse to no longer commute or pay £5k+ a year to travel on dirty, overcrowded, and overrunning train services.

items.title: Yes it's tough, but no excuse!
items.review_text:
Before the government asked everyone to stay at home, the business I worked for suggested everyone work from home. I surrendered my season ticket and while doing so even commented to the station staff they must be getting a lot of these requests. As per the website and what was told I should have received the refund in up to 28 days. Obviously since then GA will have received an increased number of refund requests for season tickets. They have not yet updated the website and not updated anyone with outstanding claims regarding revised timescales.
I waited until the 28 days have passed, and have so far spoken to 3 different call centre staff, been given 3 different updated time frames (1 of which has now also passed), and been advised I will get a call back twice and not received that call back. So at the moment I don't know when I am likely to get the refund, and don't really believe my refund is being processed at all.
Understand things are tough for everyone at the moment, but this is still the worst customer experience I have ever had. And what takes so long giving a refund when the card has been returned, what is there that needs checking?

Hide behind COVID 19 all you like, your service has ALWAYS been a disgrace

items.title: Dreadful.
items.review_text:

I cannot remember the last time I wasn't at least delayed. The worst transport service I have ever experienced and recently they have rejected my refund claim despite a cancelled train which would have forced me to travel about an hour late. I may well just have been unlucky when I travelled, but it's at least been months since my last unaltered journey.

However, I do still give credit to the conductors I have met, they have been fantastic. But that doesn't help when you may never get to the destination.

AVOID IF YOU CAN.

items.title: Greater Anglia are inept
items.review_text:
Greater Anglia is possibly the most abhorrent and unprofessional organisation to conduct business within Great Britain.   This vendor welcomes consideration from its paying customers, yet repeatedly fails in delivering a service for the sums paid.  Despite a glossy website promoting “state of the art rolling stock” the reality is cold, dimly lit 30-year-old carriages that quite frankly look and smell their age; this rolling stock is better suited to a railway museum – not live service into one of the world’s greatest capital cities.  A combination of this vintage fleet and shoddy maintenance results in frequent delays, cancelations and coach reductions.  Staff attitude towards this shoddy service is best described as lackadaisical and nonplussed, at best.
Ethical conduct (the website itself is classic misrepresentation) and professional integrity within Greater Anglia are clearly not on the agenda;  not one single employee will accept responsibility for consistently woeful service.  There no accountability within this organisation; an appalling state of affairs that surely cascade from the very of top house; Jamie Burles.  Avoid this organisation at all costs.

items.title: New intercity replacement trains
items.review_text:
New intercity replacement trains. Seats uncomfortable, designed for commuter short journey trains. Bolt up right, hard. Windows are huge with no blinds, so if the sun is shining, little chance of seeing your screens. 
Sadly these are not an improvement, and regrettably I have to say the tired old trains were better. 
I think you have been sold a pup!
Given the comfort, I suggest fares are adjusted as you are now the equivalent of a low cost, Ryanair, type operator. 25% would be appropriate.

items.title: Put some clowns on the trains and give us the full circus experience.
items.review_text: I moved to Ipswich recently after living in the Midlands for years.  I thought the Virgin service from London to Birmingham International was unreliable, my God compared to the service from London to Ipswich, it was amazing.   The Greater Anglia service is very expensive and over the last few weeks at least 50% of the trains I have travelled on have been delayed and look like something from the 1950’s.   There was some joy on Tuesday morning when a new train arrived to take us to London but that joy passed as it broke down on what seemed like its maiden voyage and we were stranded for 7 hours close to Stratford. My awful experience reaches new heights when I left my phone on the train last night. Having immediately realised my error I was not permitted to re-board the train to collect it and had to watch the train pull into the sidings as it was the last train home.  I got up this morning at 430am and went to the station to retrieve my phone (tracked on find my IPhone) before the train left.  I was told that my phone wasn’t on the train despite showing the customer service individual that it was there as shown live on my Mac using the find my iPhone app.  He said that he could not retrieve it and I’d have to wait till Monday morning even though we could see the train from the platform.  Thankfully a generous cleaner overheard our conversation and through his own initiative retrieved my phone.   Greater Anglia you are a comedic enterprise masquerading as a legitimate business.  Put some clowns on the trains and give us the full circus experience.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service. Dirty unreliable trains and constant delays and yet fares continue to go up and up. Never had a week without some issue affecting my journeys and i only travel 4 days a week! They make a big deal about delay repays but take forever to process a refund and applying for it is just so time consuming. if you are looking to move house and it will put you somewhere you will need to rely on their cambridge to liv st services...think again. The only thing in their favour is the staff who do their best despite a lack of commitment from the company. god knows how they manage to attract such good people.

items.title: Shambles of a company, how do they exist?
items.review_text: Terrible service, I now drive to Stratford and use TFL, or Central Line into Liverpool St, or use C2C into London. Very high prices charged for a shambles of a service.  New trains are finally arriving but keep breaking down, so unreliable.  Old stock is filthy, short formed and often late (freight always take priority), get used to riding a bus at weekends!  Staff unhelpful, ticket offices closing and rude and aggressive ticket inspectors who need to get at least 3 "fines" per day.  How is this possible, you should be ashamed of yourselves,how has Jamie still got his job!!!!!!!

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service.  Two trains broke down at Bury St Edmunds on my outward journey from Bury. My return from Cambridge was delayed.  I could have caught the delayed  train before mine if the sign had not sent me to the wrong platform. When I pointed this out to the ticket collector,  he said "a train left at the correct time". When I mentioned the wrong signage, he said "there's no need to be rude to me' . I had not been rude in the slightest! They deserve to lose the franchise.

items.title: Terrible service
