items.title: Regular commuter shares a typical experience
items.review_text:
Our morning train got cancelled due to a 'train fault' the other week, and we were asked to wait for the bus. Even though there were a few seats spare on it, the driver only allowed one person on and then drove away. As this was not a manned station (but apparently one of the busiest for morning commutes), we did not know if another bus was coming. Many of us pressed the green Help button at the information stand, but only I was able to be transferred to the Greater Anglia helpline. Apparently they had "lost" the bus, but we were reassured that it was still coming.

We stood in the (very cold) wind and rain, and when it did eventually turn up, we had been waiting for an hour and a half. Everyone was late for work, one person was on their last warning from their employer over lateness due to the trains, and we were soaked through. When the first bus got to the destination station, someone asked if the other bus was on its way. The response? "They should have called our helpdesk and we would have arranged a taxi". At no point during any of our attempts to do so was a taxi offered. It never is. There is sometimes a suggestion that we should just phone one ourselves, but that just diverts the blame. Why should we pay out of our own pocket when we have already paid for season tickets? I appreciate that traffic can cause a bus to be late, but no one at Greater Anglia seemed to know what was going on.

This happens on the regular- no they will not help, so we should wait an undetermined amount time until the next one comes. Even worse, there have been many occasions when they know well in advance that it is going to be cancelled, yet they still refuse to sort out alternative transport.

items.title: Trains are regularly delayed or…
items.review_text: Trains are regularly delayed or cancelled. They refuse to reissue certain tickets if lost, even with proof of receipt... Expensive, unreliable & unhelpful. What a winning combination

items.title: I’m only rating one because I can’t…
items.review_text: I’m only rating one because I can’t rate zero. This reason is due to the terrible costumer service. The attendants do are not helpful at all and the online and phone contacts just took me around in a circle and they all said that no one could help me after I was wrongfully fined for not getting a ticket. Every  worker I went to for help either ignored me, passed me on or gave me the wrong information. If you can help it I suggest you choose another way to travel, it’s not worth the money or frustration

items.title: Appalling service yesterday to Norwich…
items.review_text: Appalling service yesterday to Norwich as 9.30 a.m. train cancelled. Luckily we had arrived at Liverpool Street early so managed to get the earlier train with moments to spare.  However, on the way back three trains after 4.30 p.m. had actually been cancelled. We caught the a replacement 5.04 p.m. service as again we had arrived at the station early for our train.  As we had First Class tickets we did have seats but second class passengers were standing!  Terrible service overall as one should not have to arrive at a station three quarters of an hour early to catch one's train.  Obviously the route needs a new franchise.

items.title: Very inconsistent customer service.Some…
items.review_text: Very inconsistent customer service.Some staff helpful and willing to resolve the issue, while others inflexible and bullish.

items.title: No trains.
items.review_text:
Waiting at Braintree Station for 5.00pm train to Chelmsford. 
Train cancelled. 
No replacement bus
They should lose the franchise.
Pathetic service.
Been like this all week.

items.title: Train wànkers
items.review_text: Train wànkers

items.title: 10% off Black Friday Offer
items.review_text: Received the email offering 10% Black Friday discount (and made sure I did it before closing date of 13 December). Went through the website, checking out a few different fares with the discount. Was asked to input the code given for each search and eventually the code would not be accepted, even though I hadn't' actually used. Absolutely rubbish!!! I get so fed up with how bad the website is. Where the hell does all the money go when fares are annually increased? Certainly not on better service/customer care

items.title: I would like to thank greater Anglia…
items.review_text:
I would like to thank greater Anglia for motivating me to pass my driving test.

Literally got robbed. Charged me for an overpriced weekly pass just to replace every train with a bus. Won't even give me a PARTIAL refund let alone a full. 

I would of brought a bus pass if I wanted the bus ? 

Jokers.

items.title: Very badly organised ,2 months of…
items.review_text: Very badly organised ,2 months of getting the train with these and its turned up probably 3 times. I check for delays online ,no updates train online. Get to station and all fine ,minutes before trains due ,it says delayed ,then at time of delay .its cancelled .no alternative bus .next train says it's at platform .go over that's cancelled aswell .seem to spend all my time waiting for trains that are not even coming .I pay extra for the early train and end up later than if I bought the peak ticket .Not using trains anymore .Update your service online instead of lying so people buy tickets .

items.title: This service is one of the worst I have…
items.review_text:
This service is one of the worst I have ever used. Went to get a train to norwich and was kept waiting over an hour before we left the platform at cromer! Luckily the train managed to get us in to the city 5 minutes before kick off at 2pm. Even tho we were due in well over an hour before that time! 

Then on the return journey home the train left norwich on time but kept us held up in Wroxham for over 40 minutes before we could carry on with our journey! The amount the public has to pay in ticket fares does not match up to the standard of customer care and the quality of the service we get! Totally let down by a service that clearly has respect or interest in letting us know what is going on! The lack of information given just shows that the train service is only interested in profit than the level of quality and care given to its users! 

I for one will be giving this service a wide birth from now on! Totally let down by the public sector

items.title: Luxury of the new trains is fantastic
items.review_text: Luxury of the new trains is fantastic. Shame I witnessed some vandalism on the table of one train Tweeted GA with carriage details. Feel really sorry for Anglia as they are getting the blame for issues with Railtrack and network rail. It’s definitely time to go back to one company running it.

items.title: Wheels On The Train Don't Go Round And Round
items.review_text:
Just been on one of those new trains. You know. The dream models we were promised. The high tech answers to all our prayers. The ones that'll run on time. They even run when there are leaves on the line.

Trouble is they don't. 
Train delayed because these high tech dream liners need the wheels inspected before we pull out of the station. Wheel tappers and shunters,please apply for details. 

Us baffled country boys were sure it had working wheels when it pulled in to the station, two minutes earlier. 

Another case of bull baffles brains. 
Come on Abellio. 
Sort it out.

On the return journey we're told we are not stopping at a station as planned. All the passengers get off. Two minutes later, we are. All the passengers get back on. 

The Abellio Okey Kokey. 
In out,  out, shake it all about. 

Can't beat Abellio. 
They don't call them good for nothing. 
Oh, they do?

items.title: Horrible company
items.review_text:
Horrible company! Avoid it if you can! Delays cancelled trains everyday... Have never seen that before with another company. Moreover, wifi doesn't work Most of the time, plug for mobile doesn't work dirty and old carriage.
0 star!!!!

items.title: Rubbish compensation
items.review_text: Greater Anglia offered a refund for an advance ticket of £14.20  but instead gave me £11.20 . On complaining during a THREE hour long telephone conversation that they were in the wrong and after complaing regarding the £3 shortfal, they have given me the £3 plus a very generous TWO pounds compensation! Fabulous Customer Service Joseph Faterni Customer Relations

items.title: I understand it's a lots of issues…
items.review_text: I understand it's a lots of issues ,weather conditions, accidents ect.but this service is very, very bad!!!Delays or cancellation happening few times a week!It's ridiculous!.All management should be replaced because they cant do their job properly!

items.title: Unfortunately have no choice but to…
items.review_text: Unfortunately have no choice but to commute on these trains to work daily. Other reviews pretty much sums it up, always delayed, cancelled and dirty. Yet they think it's acceptable to increase prices every year. Trains that do actually run end up overcrowded due to lack of carriages. Roll on getting a car as fed up with the entire service.

items.title: cold and noisy trains
items.review_text: Caught 8:47 train from Colchester to Norwich commencing from my home station of Bures. Whilst trains were on time the Bures train was cold (as is often the case) and I had to move three times on the Norwich service to find a warm carriage that wasn’t noisy due to faulty automatic doors between carriages. This seems petty but in the context of a cost of £40.90 I expect better.

items.title: Little hitlers on trains
items.review_text: Little hitlers on trains. Strut around barking orders and talking to people especially vulnerable and women like kids. Reminds me of the war films when the nazis got on trains shouting papers. These horrible jumped up trains conductors should be more human and not rude in anyway. Sort this out Anglia trains.

items.title: An encouragement to drive
items.review_text: I commute to Norwich each day via train and the service from Greater Anglia is truly terrible. Dirty, cold, uncomfortable trains that are more often not delayed or cancelled. Shame on you Greater Anglia! It is because of train operators like you that Labour want to re-nationalise the railways. You clearly do not care about your customers, only your profits.

items.title: No stars from me
items.review_text: No stars from me. The service between Newmarket and Cambridge is shocking. Daily cancellations, delays or like today one carriage when three isn't enough.  Had to wait over an hour for the next train which was a non commuter train but with three carriages. How does that make sense. How these people retain a contract is beyond me.

items.title: Shocking service
items.review_text: Greater Anglia provide a service that is beyond appalling. Endless delays and cancellations whilst passengers are constantly prevented from boarding due to trains consisting of one carriage. A blight on East Anglia

items.title: If only there was an option for the poo…
items.review_text:
If only there was an option for the poo emoji instead of stars.
I literally don't know where to start. The fact that they use the word "greater" in their name is insult to anyone who has ever used their service. The trains are Always delayed, cancelled, overcrowded, dirty, with no working toilets. At least 30 degrees in summer and below freezing in winter. I honestly dont know how it's possible to be as bad at something that is your job and be allowed to carry on with it.
Every single complaint Is met with the excuse "we are upgrading our trains" But for how long.... Using this service on a regular basis has knocked at least 5 years of my life expectancy. If you have literally any other option for travel do that instead even if it involves riding tandem on a unicycle for 8 hours non stop. You will thank me later.

items.title: Avoid Greater Anglia where possible.
items.review_text:
If you live in Braintree do not rely on this service. If it's not delayed it's often cancelled. Or like today, constant notifications of delay followed by reassurance from staff the train is coming to be told its cancelled. So there will be a replacement bus service you assume? No too late notice... But f*** your paying customers. You know if a train is coming or not, the least you can do is be straight with customers from the start so we can make plans. So as I say people, use Greater Anglia as a last resort. Either bus to Chelmsford or 133 to Stansted and a coach to Stratford/express into London. Much more reliable services, more aggrovation but at least you know it'll happen.

Greater Anglia can be described best as unreliable and overpriced. Avoid where possible. They'll likely reply but the same poor service has gone on for years, they obviously need a big staff shake up.

items.title: Shame on you, Greater Anglia
items.review_text:
I’m sorry, East Anglia. You are stuck, for the time being, with this awful train company. What a terrible experience I’ve had with this company today. OK, there were the usual delays, filthy carriages and sky high fares  when I travelled to Nottingham and back, but we come to expect this,
My gripe is to do with the mobile app and the electronic ticket wallet. Naively, I accidentally activated my return ticket yesterday for travel today. Having realised my mistake I contacted the company, only to be treated like a piece of dirt and handed round to various departments. I was told that I would have to purchase a new ticket with no goodwill shown on their part. However, East Midlands Rail Company station staff came to the rescue and allowed me to travel when I explained the problem. Greater Anglia, you need to treat your passengers with more respect.

items.title: I ve just moved to witham well been…
items.review_text: I ve just moved to witham well been here just over a month , and every week there is delays or trains cancelled, so end up missing appointments which doesn't look good , the carriage are dirty and smelly , when u complain it takes weeks for it to get sorted , if you want a train line like this move to north essex , if not stay away

items.title: Delays and dirty carriages
items.review_text: What a shambles of a train service. We travelled from London to Norwich. On the way out we were delayed by 3 hours. The return train was also delayed. Misinformation and chaos from staff through the whole journey. We bought first class tickets - what a joke! The carriages were filthy dirty and cramped. The seats don’t even have pull down tray tables. There was no food or drink available to anyone on the train and limited toilet facilities. Just about the worst train journey we have ever taken. I realise delays are sometimes inevitable but there is no excuse for the lack of information and assistance, dirty uncomfortable carriages and lack of catering and toilet facilities.

items.title: clearly hasn’t been cleaned...very disappointed...
items.review_text: Clearly hasn’t been cleaned! Underneath the seats and around the bins were so dirty-almost didn’t want to sit down! Would’ve liked to have used facilities on the train but due to one of the toilets being flooded with water from a tap that hadn’t been turned off (must have been a inch deep!) and the other toilet having vomit around and in the facility  i decided to wait till i got to the station. Overall not satisfied at all with the cleanliness of the train and very disappointed! ☹️

items.title: Useless
items.review_text: My wife an kids got a train to lowestoft was fine an then on the return the train was not there with no arrival time so my wife applied for a refund barring in mind the tickets were £28 they said we would get £4.30 refund as the train turned up 13/4 hours late so she still could have got it!

items.title: Beware
items.review_text:
Beware! Trains do not accept Oyster or Contactless Cards. But they do not warn you about this, and you can get on the train by using your Oyster or contactless, and they make you pay a penalty fee at the arrival station.
This is fraud..

items.title: Greater Anglia seem to hate cyclists
items.review_text:
Greater Anglia seem to hate cyclists in fact they don't want them on they're horrible 'new trains' at all. They claim bikes get in the way of  passengers. As a Dutch firm I wonder if they have the same policies in Holland? In Switzerland where they originate from they have places for bikes on these trains 
Also these trains don't replace the comfortable old Norwich trains, they are more  like the old stopping trains, the coaches seats are small, hard and cramped 5 abreast with few toilets. As an ex commuter I'm really glad I won't have to use them.

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text: Poor service! Every day late from Stowmarket to Bury st edmunds! Every day i am latę in job and my kids to school because train cant arrive on time. I understand few times but 2 weeks and every every day it is just discusting.

items.title: Weekend works
items.review_text: Service is shocking, Wi Fi is poor but staff are friendly. How long will this weekend work go on for? The joys of bus replacement continues......

items.title: Braintree train nightmare
items.review_text: I boarded a train at Braintree station at 5.43am as I needed to be in Canary Wharf before 8am. What a nightmare I didn't know that you have to change at witham for a train to Stratford sitting in the dark at the side of tracks on an empty train. So I called customer service who advised that they would have to call me back. Anyway got a call back to say that I would have to wait until 7am before I could get off, then train wouldn't be pulling in until Colchester and I would need to pay to get back. I'm am now sitting at witham to get back to Braintree and no train until 8.35. Why could they have not pulled train forward so I could get off.  I'm not impressed as always a delay or something on Greater Anglia and customers pay enough for a shoddy service.

items.title: Once again Monday morning at least…
items.review_text:
Once again Monday morning at least 120-140 commuters. And a 4 carriage service arrives 6.33 from Waltham cross to Liverpool Street. 
The carriages are full and commuters left on platform.On a positive at least it turned up. Will the rail operators and any investigation journalists please, please, please start to sanction penalties upon this network it’s everyday there is a failure. How do they continue to operate in this manner.

items.title: Poor customer service from staff
items.review_text: Poor customer service from staff, sunday no notice on board and I just missed a train, i asked the staff at platform when is the next train due, no eye contact and just says 15. I am thinking 15 what, 15 days? Because that's about how late your trains are.

items.title: Trains are late
items.review_text: Trains are late, overcrowded..staff are awful

items.title: New trains break down
items.review_text:
New trains break down - more cancellations - same old stuff!
Bought a season ticket yesterday. First time I go to use it the 15.36 Norwich to Yarmouth cancelled - brand new train broken. Next time this morning the 7am from Yarmouth cancelled. Next attempt the 16.38 from Norwich cancelled - brand new train failed! Not bad - 3 trains out of 3 attempts failed. When asked to cancel season ticket and refund the money so I could use the bus they refused and said they charge a fee to cancel. I would like to charge them when they cancel but no choice!! Bus will win hands down in future.

items.title: Lack of seats and poor service or help.
items.review_text:
Commute 2-3 times a week to London when needed for work, usually not enough seats for all passengers and have to stand on aisles or sit of the floor.

Received fine for accidentally buying the wrong tickets to London one day, despite showing that I usually buy the right ticket. I showed I usually buy the right ticket for a period of 2 months, still didn’t matter. I feel like train companies exist to sting customers at any opportunity. Wish there were appropriate alternative means to travel to London.

items.title: awful customer service
items.review_text: I left my bag on the train and the customer service is awful no one is there for you to call or speak to all of the lost property numbers are the same making it impossible to speak to anyone from different stations

items.title: Greater Anglia Website
items.review_text:
Greater Anglia Website - Online Price Promise Statement:
Unbeatable prices. That's a promise.

Book via our website or mobile app and you can be sure the price you pay is the best you'll find anywhere. That's because of our Online Price Promise. In the unlikely event you do find a cheaper deal for the same point-to-point journey and ticket type, we'll match it and refund the difference.

However, after 4 phone calls to various different departments, on all occassions on hold for 20mins, I was wasting my time trying to negotiate a refund for the Children's Charity group that we took out to London for the day. I was told by the final person I spoke to that there was a key phrase "ticket type" that meant that we were not entitled to any refund. 
We had a large group of 10 adults and 12 children and it would have been cheapest to buy 5 family tickets rather than 2 large group bookings and 1 family - it would have saved us £182.
Bad customer service and complete waste of time! Please don't PROMISE something you have no intentions to uphold

items.title: Anal probe
items.review_text:
Ejaculate on seats. Seats are dreadful would prefer wooden bench. Excessive announcements on station and train. Annoying door alarm. Excessive use of train horn. Crap trains, overhead wire melts in warm weather. Overpriced. Customer support non existent.
Majority of profits go towards improving the French railway system.

items.title: Avoid this service
items.review_text: If going to the sea side avoid this service as they only put 1 carriage on. Staff at Norwich station was unhelpful need more training rather be on their phones than helping customers

items.title: Safety at risk due to train conductor...
items.review_text: Was asked to leave a train at stow market because I had got the train an hour earlier - due to the fact I’m a girl on my own going through London and didn’t want to be out late - didn’t know that getting a different time train would be an issue ( as this has not been an issue in the past )! I was met by the most rude train conductor who had no empathy towards the situation ( I did get upset and I did swear but not in an aggressive way ) and was then confronted by him explaining that if I swear I will be arrested at the next stop ! ( at no point have I been aggressive was just rather frustrated and upset ) - I was made to get off at stowmarket station there was no waiting area, it was dark out side and freezing cold and was told to man up as my train is in an hour! - honestly not surprised that this Trainline has a 1 star review as the staff are extremely rude! If I was asked nicely to leave the train there would have been no issue but the manner in which I was spoken to by a grown man who in his words called it “his train” was disgusting! Sorry would like to see the evidence that he In fact owns the train please ? shambles of a trainline, my safety was put at risk, I am a 21 year old girl left on my own at a place I’ve never been because I got an earlier train that what i had booked! Would like a response to this please and would like to know the name of the conductor on the 21:00 train from Norwich station 01/09/19. Thanks

items.title: Greater Anglia customer service desk is…
items.review_text:
Greater Anglia customer service desk is a SAD service. 
And writing to these bunch of people is absolutely waste of our time and energy, they are completely insensitive towards customer issues, these bunch of people definitely are not customer friendly at all.
I am extremely disappointed to know about their decision to not to refund my money, they very well know and understand that the ticket which got misplaced was unused and my explanation was genuine, I had produced all the necessary artefacts (receipt , my credit card statements , my new photo id pass that I purchased) . to prove my point and that I deserve a refund of 102 pounds, which these people took a decision not to refund.
They, in fact, responded stating that "Upon investigation, I can see that my colleague Darren has let you know that tickets are the responsibility of the customer and must be kept safe.
This is the correct policy and is therefore unable to refund your ticket on this occasion."
In my case, I admitted the ticket has been misplaced, and your duty is to investigate find out if the ticket has been actually utilized or not and then provide a refund accordingly, instead gave away easy and lazy judgement.
Then what happens to the customer who gets robbed in the street and they also happens to lose their monthly or weekly pass ?????

Now let me tell you issues with your ticketing machine and bugs in your system.

1. The entry gate should not open while putting in the receipt card.
unfortunately for me, the entry gate opened while I put the receipt card and I travelled till Liverpool station only to realize I was holding a receipt and not the actual ticket.
2 The ticketing machine should and must give proper unfolded card/ticket.
unfortunately, in my case, the machine first gave out a folded card which I assumed to be a waste card and put it in the bin. 
3 The new weekly ticket I purchased doesn't open the entry and exit gate at all.
unfortunately, I had to use them as a display card. 

Note: All kinds of flaws from Greater Anglia service, we customers are expected to accept and adjust, and there is no policy in favour of customers at all.  
Case Reference: GA190805-BBCR

items.title: I don’t even want to give them a star
items.review_text:
I don’t even want to give them a star! So many unhelpful staff being paid to do nothing helpful for the customers! Why did it even get privatised if these companies cannot even deliver a proper service! it cost so much money to travel, and when you ask your money’s worth you are discouraged to ask this forbidden request! 
I had travelled many places by rail in Europe and everything works perfectly and the customer service is great! However, here especially greater anglia is rubbish! So old fashioned! So many staff giving you so many different information! 
It is so complicated to order your ticket online you are given like hundreds of options! Then that’s not enough you get asked to print out your ticket which adds up to 10 little cards are that are so easy to loose or get dropped, wed, damaged or chewed by your dog! It is not environmentally friendly either! To make the things more interesting they do not give you the option to reprint your tickets even though you have all the details on your email! Why not send it to your phones wallet !? Or reprint? It is so backwards! Catch up with technology greater anglia! 
The customer service is so rubbish you cannot even get your say across! I have also been told that there is no complaint department! Is that true greater anglia!?

items.title: Just tried to use the web-site to buy…
items.review_text:
Just tried to use the web-site to buy some tickets but it doesn't want to take my money! Click on "Buy Tickets" and nothing happens. Before that it was difficult to select the trains you want (had to delete browsing history) and move on to the next stage.

What a shambles.

items.title: Frequently overcrowded with unhelpful staff
items.review_text:
Travelling from Woodbridge to Ipswich is in cramped, overcrowded carriages which frequently means standing for the 25 minute ride. On one train in the 2019 summer, a member of the train crew went outside the train and appeared in the windows encouraging standing passengers on an already cramped train to push together. How can this be safe or legal?

The return journey can be worse. On one recent Sunday, train crew were unable to separate two trains so taxis were ordered in an entirely random way. Bizarrely train staff didn't inform passengers this was happening until the taxis arrived. It's either very poor customer service or staff couldn't care less.

items.title: Bikes on Greater Anglia.  Ipswich staff good, Norwich staff bad.
items.review_text:
I understand that there needs to be a limit of 6 bicycles on the Greater Anglia Norwich to Ipswich Line because of the new trains.
I understand that you need a reservation.
I understand that an online or phoned reservation has to be done at least 24 hours in advance (so much for spontaneous cycle rides)
What I love is that Ipswich counter staff are happy to book your bike if you turn up just before travel and there is a space.
What I don't understand is that Norwich counter staff refuse to do this.
Also what is frustrating, is that if you break up your long cycling trip and want to use an unmanned station to get home - you can't!   You might get on the train but then the connecting intercity guard won't let you on his train even if the goods van is empty.  So much for progress, keeping fit and being green.

items.title: So I payed nearly £6 for a single to be…
items.review_text: So I payed nearly £6 for a single to be on a train for half hour which had sick on the floor, and not one train worker cared about the fact everyone on this train has to deal with the smell of sick on the floor in the middle of a carriage walk way. Disgusting🤢

items.title: Would rather go a long distance walking…
items.review_text: Would rather go a long distance walking than taking this blood-sucking service, run on robbing passengers via misinformation. The UK would be a better place if railway services like this went bankrupt.

items.title: Ripping people off
items.review_text: Unhelpful, ripping people off, beware when buying tickets to Stansted Airport.

items.title: Awful rolling stock
items.review_text: Awful rolling stock, dirty out dated unreliable. The platform staff and station staff are great, its the management and the way they treat customers that needs sorting out. Lies after lies after lies. The whole rail franchise system is a farce as can be showcased perfectly by Abellio Greater Anglia.  I dread having to use them but i have no other option :-(

items.title: Rubbish treatment from staff
items.review_text: Constantly delayed paired with rude and abusive service from staff.

items.title: Total shambles on Thursday, hottest day of the year
items.review_text: Greater Anglia, you should be ashamed of yourselves! All services between Cambridge and Liverpool St Station suspended between 3.00 and 5.00 pm on Thursday, the hottest day of the year! No contingency plans in place although you had known about the hot weather at least a week prior to this. Passengers were just supposed to find a way of getting to their destination, no replacement buses, endless queues for private taxis in temps of 38C! After having arrived at the station at 3.00 pm, it took me 2 hours to find a taxi to get home and I was charged £30. I very much doubt that I will be given a refund by you! Trains in India work better than they do in the UK and contend with much higher temps. I pay a premium to travel on a daily basis from Audley end to Cambridge, yet you let down all your customers on Thursday because of your lack of forethought and planning. I am absolutely disgusted with you, Lesser Anglia!

items.title: No wifi after paying £16.50 for one stop!!
items.review_text: I am just in shock as i just paid one of the most expensive ticket for just one stop And the wifi is not even working!!! Honestly they charge ridicously money for no service!!!

items.title: DANGEROUS have just got the train from…
items.review_text: DANGEROUS have just got the train from cromer to wroxham one carriage even though they knew it was the beer festival crammed in I was elbowed in the face and head shoved in the back making me hit my face on bicycle rack damaging my glasses then to my horror pushed so hard to the floor I fell on a beer glass had drink spilt all over me and couldn't get off train at my station as no one could move i will be taking this further absolutely disgusting and dangerous

items.title: Bad experience
items.review_text: Today my Journey took 3 hours form stratford to waltham cross. The train was broken and stopped between 2 stops. We were waiting for second train over one hour and when he finally came they resignated and they towed It back on station. After this time we were waiting next hour to taxi becouse we had 11 Month baby. The taxi didnt came after over 30 min.. very bad organisation of transport.. in the train was to much hot and no air conditioning...Mabye the trains should have service more often.

items.title: Would not recommend
items.review_text: I boarded the train in Liverpool Street Station to travel to Stansted, intending to buy a ticket on the train as I was running late. There were no barriers in Liverpool Street and no indication that a ticket needed to be bought before boarding, which I only found out on the train. At that point there was no way to get a ticket and avoid the £38 fine in Stansted. The journey itself was okay but I've never seen another train company try and do something like this.

items.title: Best not to be disabled or pregnant!
items.review_text:
I am disabled and have difficulty walking or standing for any extended period of time. Nobody offered me a seat but there was a couple of free seats in first class. Unable to stand up any longer I either had to sit in first or sit on the floor.
I opted for first class. Consequently, I was fined. When I appealed I received an email that pretty much said “your appeal was denied, you have to pay to sit in first class”. Perhaps if greater actually policed the seats for the disabled/pregnant even half as intensely as they police fare evaders, this needn’t have happened. But I guess that wouldn’t generate much income.

items.title: This train company is an absolute…
items.review_text:
This train company is an absolute joke!!! I have travelled extensively by train around the world and have never encountered any worse than this. 

I'm writing this review just a couple of hours after my incident with Greater Anglia. I landed at Stansted Airport, went to the train station to catch a train to Cambridge. I thought it would be a direct journey, with no stops. The guy who sold me the ticket didn't tell me I would have to get off at one stop and catch another train to Cambridge. On top of this, there were no notifications, signs or anything on the train informing passengers travelling to Cambridge to get off at the next stop. Nothing. As a result, I ended up in Liverpool Street, London, at 1:00am where I am now. Next train to Cambridge is at 4:00am. Any serious, modern train company would inform passengers of the itinerary to their destination including stops. Not Greater Anglia. Trains in third world countries work better than this. What a shame to the UK to have such a terrible train company. Absolutely terrible!!!

items.title: I am sharing this everywhere
items.review_text:
I am sharing this everywhere. Beware of trusting this joke of a company. My son was  stranded in London from saturday night to sunday 6am. He has just turned 18.
Faults on line but no replacement service laid on. All station staff went into hiding. No help from Rail Police or National Rail Enquiry line (even the Manager had no customer service skills). You have to wait until 8am to speak to someone and they will argue that despite hundreds trying to get taxis, even with no cash on you, you should be able to get a taxi at 2/3/4 am to do a 100 mile run home. Oh, and having no coats as it the summer, not enough foil blankets. Apparently how can tney prepare for that!!! I know primary school children that could do a better job than you. My son uses the trains every day. I am now pushing his driving lessons through as you are an absolute disgrace.

items.title: Well done
items.review_text:
Dear, 
I really hope this feedback reaches the customer satisfaction team in concern to 2 employees who were in charge of the 8:30 train to Norwich.

We arrived to find 2 people sitting in our table that was reserved on that day, the people in the seats refused to move for our assigned seats done asked Emily and lyan for help 
Emily and lyan are superb employees that have went forwards and had the most professional dialogue with the ladies sitting in our seats, they were both professional and accommodating to the other customers who were stubborn and loud as well as wouldn't leave the seat without making an unnecessary argument. 

Lyan under the supervision of Emily has offered the people in our seats to change them to other locations and have taken with professionalism the bad attitude they had received from the people in our seats.
To solve the issue both Emily and lyan have guided us to first class seats which we have appreciated so much after a long day of traveling all the way from South America with over 15 hours of flying, the comfort they have provided us and going the extra mile with providing snacks and water to make up for the situation after having us seated in first class is going above an beyond to accommodate a customer. 

I would like for their extremely professional attitude and great customer care to be noted and taken as example for other employees to follow.

Thank you so much Emily and lyan you both have been wonderful and we can't thank you enough for making our journey truly pleasant.

Kind regards

items.title: I don't travel by train very often but…
items.review_text: I don't travel by train very often but when I do, your staff are a credit to you... Even when sorting replacement buses for passengers.

items.title: Horrible service
items.review_text:
Horrible service. I'm on my way to Stansted Airport. 
My first train was cancelled. Second was coming in an hour. I had to take an alternate route. The trains on that route were 13 mins delayed. 
Now I'm sitting on a train, hoping that I'll make it to the plane ✈ on time.. 

It's my first time using greater Anglia to Stansted and definitely the last!

Wasted money on a service which troubled me mentally and physically. 

Next time I'll go with National Express,  although longer, but at least reliable.

items.title: Aggressive staff
items.review_text:
I am writing this  today to express my disappointment with the customer service I have experienced in your Cambridge station. 

I was told to “p*** off” by a member of your staff called Carlton. I told him a mistake had been made with my ticket and I had 5 minutes to rectify it before my train had arrived  I had more than enough time to make the train and when I had asked Carlton how long it would take to resolve the issue he simply ignored me regardless of me informing him I was about to miss my train. He then asked if I had a rail card didn’t want to see it and had applied a discount on my ticket. I told him I am about to miss my train and he responded by saying “this your problem mate, you shouldn’t have booked the wrong ticket” out of frustration I asked if he was joking and he replied “p*** off” I am extremely disappointed and offended by this especially as I use your train network every weekend. In the future I will be making alternative arrangements to travel into Cambridge. I have never been spoken to in the way and I don’t think Carlton specifically represents your company well enough to wear the logo on his shirt. This is a massive shame.

items.title: Unclean, foul and out of date
items.review_text: Greater Anglia trains are mostly always late or cancelled, the staff are always rude and mostly ignore you. The trains are really out of date and the trains are foul and look like they have not been cleaned in years, apparently there are some new trains coming in 2019, but yet to see any. The stations are usually unclean and out of date, disgraceful

items.title: It is currently 11 degrees outside and…
items.review_text:
It is currently 11 degrees outside and I am sitting in one of the Greater Anglia trains from Norwich and there is AIR CONDITIONING ON!!!! What an absolute nonsense and waste. Who is benefiting that because surely not passengers or environment. My feet are freezing and the conductor said 'it is automatic and we can't do nothing'.

Greenpeace!!!! CAN WE PLEASE TACKLE THAT?

items.title: Services and trains are disgusting
items.review_text: Services and trains are disgusting. I rather travel on Cairo metro or use transportation in the mid East as they are free and clean. Greater Anglia services are known as harami

items.title: they've made delay repay really inconvenient to use
items.review_text:
I think the delay repay service, while being advertised as even easier and better than it was is actually designed to make it really hard to claim a refund.
because I didn't want a cheque (who does these days?! or vouchers  I had to apply online which they advertise as 'a few clicks'. They require detailed info plus a photo of the ticket uploaded in a way they approve of but even more annoying they ask you to input various bits of reference numbers which are confusing and anyway  can be clearly read on the ticket anyway (so you've submitted these already). all made to make it really hard to claim which I think is just dishonest.

items.title: Abellio Greater Anglia is funded by the EU and is owned by the Dutch Government and the European Union  until 2025!
items.review_text:
This trustpilot review is exposing the true nature of Abellio Greater Anglia and why you should not apply for a career with them.

Abellio is advertising jobs but the website has scarce information on culture, experience required or company values.

So I googled and found some Abellio staff offering advice, unofficially on job seeker sites.

I posted a Q&A thread with concerns I'd found reviews and proof on social media that Abellio's Recruitment drive was tainted by nepotism (only hiring close family members, friends or associates), hiring cronies and undesirables (some have confirmed criminal records) who bully fellow staff. This is backed by former workers on glassdoor and other job review websites.

(I cannot post links to external websites)

As you would've seen the responses, staff hired by Abellio Greater Anglia, not only didn't answer these accusations, but they confirmed it with hostility from behind a keyboard.
They also used derogatory discriminating language against Disabled people.

One person claiming to be a Greater Anglia employee, thinks that free speech or questioning potential workplace bribery within Abellio is "trolling" and that Abellio's recruitment process is beyond scrutiny.

I have tagged Abellio Greater Anglia, whom are still owned by the Dutch based Operator until 2025 (and their legal trading name is still "Abellio Greater Anglia"). Their replacement fleet of STADLER trains were manufactured in Switzerland coming in from Europe. Greater Anglia purposefully chose the EU based STADLER over the British based manufacturer Bombardier.
This is despite Bombardier offering their services and contracts as a British Manufacturer, which were shunned by Abellio Greater Anglia in 2016. 
Bombardier had proven they can successfully manufacture new trains with London's Crossrail trains in 2014 in the UK.

Greater Anglia and it's staff (owned by the Dutch Government Abellio brand until 2025) recieved £2.5 Billion (yes £2.5 Billion) of money from the European Union so are staff who benefit from being in the EU.
So would Abellio staff also refrain from posting anti-EU and Pro-Brexit comments on their Facebooks while revealing they publicly work for Abellio Greater Anglia on social media.

items.title: Paid 1st Class, Got Cattle Class!
items.review_text: Bought a 1st Class return from Liverpool Street to Manningtree online for travel on Tuesday 14th May @11:00 departure reserved seating, only to discover the train had been cancelled: "A problem with the train". Ended up having to take a normal commute train that was filthy, no dedicated 1st Class section, no buffet service, refreshments etc, etc. Paid a premium for nothing! (Interestingly no ticket inspection on board) Greater Anglia are efficient at taking your money, less so at providing what you've paid for. I'd suggest if you are thinking of travelling 1st Class DON'T BUY YOUR TICKET IN ADVANCE. Check at the station prior to travel that the service IS ACTUALLY OPERATING before parting with your money.

items.title: Appalling company in a monopoly situation
items.review_text:
Would give less if I could. I have been commuting with them for 4 years and 18 months ago I needed to start taking my bike on the train to get to work at the other end. Recently they announced that they are restricting the number of full size bikes allowed on my route due to new trains having reduced capacity, this for trains into Cambridge where there are more bikes than cars. Add to that their inability to transport lost items to a nearer station than the station where it was discovered and a £10 courier fee if you can't pick it up. Adding to all the above there is a severe lack of consistency in their operation, the trains are late, shortened (sometimes to 1/3rd their normal length which is too short anyway) or cancelled.

 The government is supposed to be against monopolies but every region has a 1. I am now looking at buying a car and driving to work. Looks like I won't be helping the environment.

items.title: It's a surprise if my train is ever on…
items.review_text:
It's a surprise if my train is ever on time. They are always packed and uncomfortable, and ridiculously overpriced.

The worst train service I have ever used.

items.title: Caught the 1800 from Norwich to…
items.review_text:
Caught the 1800 from Norwich to Liverpool Street. 6th May 2020. had booked and paid for 1st class with reserved seat. 
The usual train had been replaced by an old local train. The 1st class section consisted of identical seats to second class, but with 1st class labelling. No comfort, no wi-fi, no power source for laptops of phones, no refreshments, no staff, no apology. I asked what was going on at Norwich and a member of staff just said, the first class are at the front and offered no explanation. A muffled announcement at Norwich mentioned something about repairs to trains meant there had to be a change. I couldn't really hear. I didn't take a book as I had intended to use the wi -fi and use my computer. That is why I booked first class in the first place. So I sat unproductive, bored and grumpily wondered why this had happened and why nothing was said. Incidentally, at Norwich station all the coffee shops had pretty much closed, (before 1800) but I didn't worry too much because there's always  the buffet ..or not!
Very poor train service, customer service by rail staff and general communication. I don't suppose there will be any recompense.

items.title: 1st class weekend travel
items.review_text: Bought a first class ticket on a weekend trip. Told when on train that I was no longer entitled to any complementary refreshments at weekend. Why wasn't this highlighted to me when I booked ticket?

items.title: Very rude staff at Liverpool st
items.review_text: Very rude staff at Liverpool st, horrible experience overall.

items.title: rubbbish service and compensation theft
items.review_text: I arrived for a train having bought a rail ticket earlier in the day at the machine around the corner from the main platform where you can get disabled access, unlike the other platform only to note that the train had been summarily cancelled. I asked the operator in the squawk box what was happening and was advised tht there is fault and i can catch the next train which is in over an hours time. As I Had an appointment in Norwich at an agreed time this was f***ing useless. So I drove to Norwich and put in a claim for the cost of the ticket . However I was advised that as my delay for a return ticket had not been over TWO HOURS I was only entitled to half my fee back This is not service this is daylight robbery for providing nothing.

items.title: Greater Anglia will rip you off
items.review_text: Their website is intentionally misleading.  My tickets should have been £19.50, but I paid £32.  Rather than give me a full refund or refund the difference, they wanted to charge me massive administrative fees.  Worst train company in all of the UK!!  CEO email is jamie.burles at greateranglia.co.uk if you want to complain to him.

items.title: I pay a  expensive ticket and they…
items.review_text:
I pay 24 march my ticket and they don't even give you bus replacement for the customers! I was forced to pay from my own pocket my bus, lost my money or they offer to go Cambridge to go London!! Unacceptable. .
Very upset. Claims will take years, and reaching customer service is by post. So good luck!!!
Also the customer service are awful. They care if you travel without ticket, but if you pay they don't longer care. A shame for UK.
No happy.

items.title: Disgusting behaviour from staff
items.review_text: Ticket conductor accused my 15 year old daughter and her 15 year old boyfriend of being over 16 because he had facial hair!!! He wouldn't even scan the tickets and told them to have a good evening at the pub!! Absolutely disgraceful behaviour. Will never use the Brundall to Norwich service again

items.title: One of the worst train companies on the…
items.review_text:
One of the worst train companies on the planet. During the mid off-peak day ticket up to half of the trains are either cancelled or late. I don't seem to be able to do a journey Monday to Friday from Hertford to London without at least half of the trains being late, cancelled due to made up issues so they can save money on running a proper service. I really love it when they run a 4 carriage train in rush hour too so that every station after 2 stops is then full of annoyed and stressed people trying to cram onto a packed train. 

Horrible money grabbing company!

items.title: A disgrace of a train line
items.review_text:
Broxbourne to Liverpool Street service here.
Terribly disrupted train services, lack of communication between drivers and passengers, terrible pricing for such an awful service... The list is endless.

Such an awful service and I'd highly advise avoiding it wherever necessary.

items.title: Delays delays delays
items.review_text:
I live on an intermediate stop so the trains are only every half an hour. I accept this and am happy with that.  However, in January my outbound trains were on time only 4 times.  How can that be acceptable?

When there are delays over a certain time, then they just cancel the train from stopping at my stop which means i then have to wait another half an hour for a train and often i can't get on them because they are so busy or they are only 4 carriages. So that's an hour to wait.

Nearly every week i have to request a delay repay due to a cancelled or delayed train.
The seats in the train are often broken (even in 1st class where people are paying double!)

Just really really bad service which is extortionately expensive!

items.title: Left my green military back bag in the…
items.review_text:
Left my green military back bag in the train from Stowmarket to Ipswich at 5th February 9:45am,the guys from Ipswich customer service did a grate job! In very soon i collected my bag in Colchester Customer Service office. Thank you very much guys! I really appreciate Greater Anglia! You’re my life savers! 
Great Thank you!

items.title: Appalling services with uneducated and…
items.review_text: Appalling services with uneducated and aggressive stuff!

items.title: Absolutely unacceptably poor services
items.review_text: I am writing to complain vigorously about the fact that for several years now, Greater Anglia continue to have absolutely disrupted train services from London to Norwich every single weekend. This is ridiculous. People end up having to drive because the train journeys at weekends are a. too lengthy and complicated, and b. ridiculously expensive. Greater Anglia make the journey difficult by taking two and half to three hours including changes, instead of the regular under two hours length direct and they charge £55 for the privilege, when a normal advance is £10. How can this be? This is outrageous and has gone on far too long. These engineering works were meant to have been completed months and months ago, if not years ago.I complained once before about two years ago and got a total whitewash response. I see now they have not done anything to sort it out. My friends and fellow passengers are very angry too. We all end up having to drive. With a climate crisis going on, this should be illegal for a train company to do this. Greater Anglia, when are you going to sort it out and put on normal train services at normal prices on weekends??Try IMMEDIATELY. And how about compensating us for the enormous additional fares in the meantime, and the additional car wear and tear from having to drive as we haven't got all day to meander about the country. Some of us have busy lives even if you don't. we can't just spend them meandering about from train to train for three hours, trying to get from a to b.

items.title: Commuting to/from Stowmarket
items.review_text: Commuting to/from Stowmarket. So far service has been excellent. Better than driving and parking costs.

items.title: Lost property
items.review_text: I left my bag on a great northern service at Christmas and it ended up being taken off at Cambridge which is operated by Greater Anglia and they did a fantastic job of speedily posting it back to my in London, excellent service.

items.title: overpriced.

overpriced.
£7000 a year to commute and now charge £8 per day to park.
the staff are nice, but such a shame about the provided service.
